description: Another empowering transmission in this series of spiritual emergency satsangs, Shunyamurti helps us to connect all the dots that bring us to a holistic understanding of what is real, a reminder that the current world crisis is actually a cleansing of consciousness, and that purifying our capacity to love is the only way to claim victory over all the engineered conflicts.

title: Coherent Thought is a Bridge to Liberation
description: Symbolic thinking and discernment are required to break free from the fabrication of the ego and rise to the highest Real, with love and wisdom to light the way.

title: Remove Every Trace of Ego’s Disgrace
description: Shunyamurti offers an equation that helps us to end the enslavement to mentalized consciousness and arrive at the Highest Destination, the core of the heart of God: Pi R(squared): Projection and Identification create bondage; Revelation and Realization bring Redemption.

title: How to Take Refuge with the Lord
description: DescriptionTranscriptionDownloads Summary: Shunyamurti invites  us to take the graceful path to Self-liberation, by taking refuge in the Supreme Lord and being a living temple of God-consciousness–in service of truth and freedom. How to Take Refuge with the Lord Welcome again to another Spiritual Emergency Satsang. I feel that the vibrational frequency of the field gets […]

title: The Real Self is Now Emerging in Those Who Yearn for Truth
description: It is time to leave the ego behind! Shunyamurti says it is time to shift from understanding to innerrstanding–from a place of wisdom and love–to overstanding–so we can take the highest trajectory to Liberation!

title: Conquer Death While the World is Dying
description: It is time to leave the ego behind! Shunyamurti says it is time to shift from understanding to innerrstanding–from a place of wisdom and love–to overstanding–so we can take the highest trajectory to Liberation!

title: Get Out of Time Before You’re Out of Time
description: It is time to leave the ego behind! Shunyamurti says it is time to shift from understanding to innerrstanding–from a place of wisdom and love–to overstanding–so we can take the highest trajectory to Liberation!

title: We Must Face the Death of Reason—and Cause its Resurrection
description: Shunyamurti speaks to the self-redemption of consciousness: using reason to get out of the irrational intellect and understand the Truth that reveals the Real.

title: We Must Learn to Appreciate God’s Sense of Humor
description: How could a good God allow a world this mad to come into being? Shunyamurti proposes a theory: the universe, and all of the systems within it, are inherently structured as a joke. Can you find the humor that grasps and integrates all the sides of reality into one?

title: A Numinous Power Has Taken Over the World
description: The drive to life and to God-consciousness has been shut down for most people, and they have instead been taken over by a Death Drive. There has to be a planetary transformation in human consciousness, that blows out the negative ego-form of the ego that causes us to act in ways that are self-destructive, and destructive of nature, and return to the true divine blossoming of love and life that works to create and sustain life, not to destroy it.

title: We Suffer From a Confusion of Levels of Mind
description: Shift from the unconscious to the superconscious! By understanding the 7 levels of Psychic Energies that Shunyamurti presents in this teaching module, you can transform your traumas into wisdom and change the trajectory of your destiny.

title: What is an affcept?
description: Shunyamurti expands further on the meaning of affcept.

title: Sure Luck Oms and the Case of the Missing Self
description: Shunyamurti gives Sat Yogis their mission: Become a detective of consciousness like Sure Luck Oms and solve the case of the missing Self by breaking out of body consciousness and breaking into the forbidden dimension of inmost consciousness.

title: The Laughter of the Avatar
description: Shunyamurti encourages us to go rogue! Since there are no rules in Higher Consciousness, let’s in-joy the lightness of being free, claim our right to a divine life, and join in the laughter in Liberation.

title: Don’t Mistake a Signifier for the Real
description: Signifiers produce the product of ego, which then creates the narcissistic struggle for the highest signifier, and thus a dualistic reality. But Shunyamurti reminds us not to be seduced by the signifiers of false reality, and instead make sacred the signifiers that reveal the Real.

title: The Fundamentals of Absolute Alchemy
description: Shunyamurti introduces the nine parallel spectra of sameness and difference to help us find the madhyamaka of mind that fuses all states of consciousness into the Mind of God–overcoming all sameness and difference by bringing eternal life into time. This is the alchemy of Sat Yoga.

title: Madness Can Resolve the Double Bind
description: Shunyamurti helps us to understand how the laws of karma operate (only) within the realm of Maya, and how to accept the the mad congruence between destiny and fate–by not using mad-ductive reasoning and maintaining the peace of radical (and sometimes non-rational) acceptance.

title: Activate the Poetics of Politics: From Anarchy to Sophiocracy
description: Don’t be governed by disorder! The mad state of the world is actually made of mind, and it’s the relationship of love and law that moves us from a state of anarchy to a sophiocracy, where supreme understanding of the infinite meaning-full-ness overcomes rules.

title: Prepare for a Theo-Nuclear Explosion
description: Shunyamurti instructs us on how to use Ek Om’s razor to cut away the purity of Awareness from the particularity of identification, so that only the peace and presence of the Supreme remains.

title: The Fourth Dharma Will Transform Reality
description: We are swimming in a sea of signifiers, none of which can hold the value of reality. Only the true Dharma can meet the God-standard. Shunyamurti references the Mahabharata (film) to shed light on the fourth Dharma that remains through every Yuga and every kalpa, the non-Dharma that is the nature of the Beyond.

title: Freedom vs. Antidisestablishmentarianism
description: Don’t let the antidisestablishmentarianism of the media keep you from questioning the church of pseudo-science! In these extreme times, one must question everything, especially one’s own perspective within the contradiction of narratives that are contributing to the chaos of the current world order.

title: Praise the Holy Grail of Indeterminacy
description: In this teaching, Shunyamurti offers step by step guidance on how to deploy your spiritual intelligence so a harmonious, superorganismic potentiality can emerge to solve the problem of complexity in a world of “evol” that is ever-evolving into Love.

title: Turning the Tide in the Ultimate Battle for the World
description: In the final Dao book group, Shunyamurti reminds us that we have the power to transform and transcend, and that the power of the Dao will help us to navigate these times with Truth that brings victory in the ultimate battle.

title: The Eternal Return of Spiritual Anarchy
description: Shunyamurti introduces a talk by Dan Smith about Nietzsche, giving a colorful overview of his life and the development of his personal philosophy that led him to divine madness–in an insane asylum–and his understanding of the dialectic of the drives, which takes off from where Heigel left off. This is a followup to the morning teaching, The Dialectic of the Drives.

title: The Dao Caused the Big Bang…and Will Soon Bring on the Big Crunch
description: ​As we come closer to the Singularity, what is important is practice. In the opening teaching of the third Dao of the Final Days book group gathering, Shunyamurti reveals the naked truth about the real Singularity and the preparations we must make for the arrival of our destiny-returning to the Dao that was before the Big Bang​.

title: Dare to Pass Through the Looking Glass
description: Maha Shiva Ratri signifies the moment that the consciousness goes through the mirror, from the phenomenal plane to the Real–we must return to consciousness without the mirror image that traps one in the illusion of life, and complete the unification of Shiva and Shakti that brings about the manifestation of Absolute Consciousness.

title: The World’s End is Being Engineered
description: Shunyamurti introduces our second Dao book group gathering with a reflection on current events: The perfect storm is being engineered to bring about the final days. Those aligned with the Dao should have no fear, but see through the planetary situation to the spiritual dimension and perceive the blessing of total breakdown-destruction is deliverance.

title: The Way of Fire, the Way of Love, and the Way of Emptiness
description: Shunyamurti reveals the Dao of Sat Yoga and how this can help us and guide us amidst the chaos of current world events, if one of the three pathways to Liberation–the Fire of Wisdom, Love and Emptiness–are chosen and realized.

title: How Much Truth Can You Handle?
description: Shunyamurti states that destiny depends on the purification of the soul and the willingness to withstand the highest truth–and all of its applications–in order to awaken to the Supreme Quest that leads to the beyond.

title: Shiva Comes Now at the Darkest Moment in History
description: Mahashivaratri is a celebration of the darkest night of the year, when Shiva comes to bring the Divine Light that ends the illusion! Shunyamurti reminds us that in this dark night of history, when all hope seems lost, it is more important than ever to realize the freedom and power of Ultimate Consciousness, by shattering the illusion with infinite love.

title: What’s Wrong With Your Operating System
description: Shunyamurti reveals the 7 symptoms of the ego’s operating system and how to treat these from the level of the soul–and raise your ordinary/extraordinary quotient to infinity–and beyond!

title: The State of the World and the Path to Freedom
description: We are in the ultimate battle for our souls, as well as for our freedom and our lives. To win this, we must increase our level of intelligence and activate our latent paranormal powers. That means we must leave behind the obsolete ego-mind and attain the innermost levels of the Self. The Core Self is within us now, and when we attune to That, we feel completely free and unbound, and able to download amazing insights. Knowledge is power. If you understand what is happening now in the world as an

title: The Secret of Accurate Practice
description: Shunyamurti shares from Vajra Speech by Tulku Urgyen Rinpoche, a nondual Zen teaching about the practice of effortlessness and the true state of accomplishment: one must trust the consequence of karma, the pain of bliss and the non importance of experience.

title: The Algorithm Has No Rhyme or Reason
description: The Kali Yuga ego is a basic algorithm based on ignorance and lack that has no control of its own destiny. Shunyamurti gives the way out of this trap: a return to superconsciousness, where real wisdom and power prevail, and where the true Singularity abides.

title: The Heart is Ripped Apart by Divergent Drives
description: Shunyamurti explains that the ultimate result of the spiritual dialectical process is Self-Realization. This can only be accomplished when the divergent drives of the thesis of the ego are overtaken by the convergent drives of the antithetical soul and translated to the ultimate level as the synthesis of Spirit.

title: Don’t Hide Your Self in a Suitcase
description: Shunyamurti uses a modern-day metaphor to helps us to unpack the ego’s baggage and discover the cosmos within: the ego is the Self in a suitcase–a monad that is also a nomad–and you must unpack your ego’s defenses and allow the ecstasy to unfold.

title: The Real is Beyond Belief
description: Shunyamurti describes advaya: no beliefs can capture Reality. If you free yourself from all beliefs, you will be free of suffering and attune to the real of nonduality. But this is not to be taken as a belief–do the experiment and discover for yourself what is True and what is Real.

title: You Must Decide Your Destiny Now
description: Transformation is a choice, and it is time to choose: the world of the ego, the loka of the soul, or the realm of Spirit–but you must first open your heart and mind to the total freedom to decide your destiny. Shunyamurti encourages us to choose the best of all possible worlds, and get off at the junction of the Singularity, the meeting point of matter and antimatter, where you meet the other side of you.

title: The Truth is Buried Under Layers of Trauma
description: Shunyamurti speaks to the real of Love, the key to reaching the Real; all ego’s are traumatized in the imaginary register of consciousness and must re-discover real love that dissolves the ego, and the self-arising wisdom that comes from wandering within the matrix, in order to transcend the dream, and to realize the great laughter of Liberation.

title: Kali Yuga is Now Reaching Its Climax
description: Shunyamurti introduces a series of short clips on Kali Yuga, outlining the fallen journey of consciousness through cyclical time, to the present moment in Kali Yuga, in which all sign point to the end times, which is really time to return to the timeless–but this can only be done through a shift in consciousness that will reveal the Truth–in time.

title: Welcome the Magi—Not Superegos
description: In this Christmas Eve teaching, Shunyamurti shares the Word that is the light of God’s Mind, reminding us to give the gift of love without projection and we can receive the gift of clear consciousness in return.

title: How to Produce the Nectar of Immortality
description: In the opening teaching of the retreat, Shunyamurti shares the secret to producing Amrita, the divine nectar of immortality that is the golden light of God-consciousness. If we want to experience the magical intoxication of infinite consciousness, we must eliminate the boundary between life and death and fearlessly embark on the potent path into the unknown.

title: How to Earn the Divine Right of Kings
description: Shunyamurti shares that Sat Yoga is the original yoga, the raja (royal) yoga that, together with gyana (the yoga of divine wisdom), is the key to mastery over the ego-mind, bringing attunement with the Mind of God–this is the act of reclaiming our spiritual royalty and returning to the Kingdom of Heaven.

title: Authentic Self-Realization Brings Divine Power
description: Shunyamurti reminds us that all karma is being settled at this time; we must go beyond the conflicts and chaos of the ego and its environment, and transcend the chaos of these final days in order to be a refuge for others and redream a new world.

title: Gems Of Wisdom Book Group – Week Twelve
description: Week Twelve covers the following essays: The Equation of Relativity, The First Page, About Shunyamurti, About Sat Yoga

title: The World is the Ego’s Projection
description: In this last phase of Kali Yuga, it is essential for Sat Yogis to realize the Truth now. But the ego-mind obscures the truth of what we are with the projections and defenses that arise from a lifetime of suffering. We must first realize our suffering is phenomenal, so we can overcome our traumas and stop the mind that suffers–and then the True Self takes over and the Truth of Reality is realized.

title: Gems Of Wisdom Book Group – Week Eleven
description: Week Eleven covers the following essays: The Butterfly Farm, Have Your Self – A Spiritual Christmas, New Year, New Forms of Formless Truth

title: Q&A – Conquer Death While You Can
description: Question and answer session that followed our screening of The Tibetan Book of the Dead: A Way of Life (1994).

title: Conquer Death While You Can
description: Prepare to reach the deathless state! In this time of sudden death, it is of extreme importance to recognize the immortality of consciousness—before the body dies—so we can transcend the plane of mortality and be reborn as immortal, deathless Spirit. This is the secret of immortality that Shunyamurti reveals in this teaching, a precursor to our next 5-day retreat, Amrita Shakti: The Potent Path of Pure Delight.

title: Gems Of Wisdom Book Group – Week Ten
description: Week Ten covers the following essays: The Seven Songs of the Soul, The Great Escape From Hell, Beyond Self-Torment: The Escape Route

title: The Situation is Hopeless, But Unreal
description: Shunyamurti offers a koan on consciousness and the logic of the transcendence of worlds; reading again from The Supreme Source, this class reminds us to let go of the mind, let go of all methods, to let go of the desire for Liberation, and ultimately to let go of the you who thinks there’s anything to let go of–and just be in your natural state (before you had an ego).

title: Gems Of Wisdom Book Group – Week Nine
description: Week Nine covers the following essays: The Self is Peace and Freedom, Self-Astonishing Mind, The Seven Onenesses, The Wind of Spirit, We Must Live In Good Faith

title: Reality is Not What it Seems
description: Sat Yoga is a wisdom school, a school of transformation in which intelligence development is paramount to understanding our ability to attune to higher consciousness and receive the energetic transmissions which grant us the knowledge, and therefore the freedom, to realize the true Reality–now is the moment when the window of opportunity is open for all who wish to leave the old world of the ego behind and enter the portal into the unknown…

title: Gems Of Wisdom Book Group – Week Eight
description: Week Eight covers the following essays: Renouncing Idol Worship, Honoring Kali, The Religions of Ego, Soul, and Self

title: The Most Intelligent Will Be Victorious
description: Sat Yoga is the art and the science of increasing our intelligence. In this teaching, Shunyamurti explains that intelligence must be developed so we are able to attune to the subtle information of the ultimate power, which will enable us to navigate life in a much more accurate and graceful manner, to be of service to humanity and the planet, and to gain the capacity to solve the perceived problems of the world.

title: Gems of Wisdom Book Group – Week Seven
description: Week Seven covers the following essays: What is a Spiritual Attitude?, The Breaking of the Shells, The Lotus Life, Monkey Traps, There Are No Stages of Liberation, Detox Your Mind

title: Re-Weave the Fabric of Reality
description: In this module teaching, Shunyamurti outlines the egoic behaviors used to sustain a false sense of self; we must destabilize the ego by deconstructing our destructive patterns if we want to escape the ego’s nightmare and dream a new Reality.

title: Gems of Wisdom Book Group – Week Six
description: Week Six covers the following essays: The Virtue of Infidelity, “Miserere Mei: Deus!”, Full Emptiness, The Ocean of Truth, Apocalypse Now? (Is That a Question?).

title: You Can’t Trust the Science, or Religion, or Your Mind.
description: Shunyamurti outlines the fall of legitimate authority and the rise of a nihilistic mentality that has taken over the world with the false doctrine of materialism; in order to be free of the bondage of illegitimate authority, we must remember that we are active participants in this great creation, and we must create a new world order based on higher consciousness, love, truth and freedom.

title: Gems of Wisdom Book Group – Week Five
description: Week Five covers the following essays: Becoming an Adult, Redemption Song, From Aleph to Omega Point, A Matter of Survival, The Virgin Path.

title: The Portal to Freedom is Now Open
description: Shunyamurti reveals that the real knot to resolve is an ego that has been betrayed by a loveless world and must now take the risk of ego death to find the secret of spiritual power and enter the portal to freedom!

title: Gems of Wisdom Book Group – Week Four
description: Week Four covers the following essays: Four Ignoble Truths (That Can Lead to Nobility), The Secret of Spiritual Power, The Magic of Love, The Ultimate Blessing.

title: Atone by Attuning to the One
description: Shunyamurti draws a map of realization, bringing together the Jewish Day of Atonement, the attunement of the soul, and at-one-ment with the Self, as a step by step guide in the trajectory of Realization, reminding us that wisdom and devotion are the keys to Liberation.

title: Gems of Wisdom Book Group – Week Three
description: Week Three covers the following essays: Sameness Vs. Oneness, What Is to Be Done?, Check Your Pride, Let’s Complete the Work of Christ, End the Search

title: Morphogenic vs Morphogenetic?
description: Shunyamurti differentiates the concept of morphogenic, relating to the virtual/noetic plane from morphogenetic, which pertains to the phenomenal plane.

title: A Maha Yogi Commands the Matrix
description: The urgency of transcendence is here and now, and Sat Yogis must pop the quantum wave of ego-consciousness to break through all obstacles and let the light of cosmic-consciousness shine with the power of love–this alone can heal the world. Shunyamurti reminds us that we are mahayogis, and we must awaken ourselves to help awaken all souls.

title: Gems of Wisdom Book Group – Week Two
description: Week Two covers the following essays: Stay Ahead of Time; The Core of Inner Silence; The Law of Dispassion; Attaining Full Empowerment; The Ego and the Noetic Field.

title: How to Gain the Potency of Total Consciousness
description: Shunyamurti begins by encouraging the sangha (both in local space and virtual space) to use every opportunity to develop our powers of consciousness so we can make use of our supernatural resources to transcend the dark times ahead. He then elaborates on a previous morning teaching, using the journey of Purusha and Prakriti, to help us understand the reality and the possibilities of ascension from matter to Spirit.

title: Gems of Wisdom Book Group – Week One
description: Week One covers the following essays: Pre-Ambulation and Circum-Ambulation; Pre-Face; An Anti-Introductuion; Who’s In Control

title: This is the Moment of Your Metamorphosis
description: Shunyamurti welcomes Sat Yogis to the real Kumbha Mela–the confluence age of the end of Kali Yuga that brings the wonders of Sangham Yuga into play! He uses a storied interpretation of the evolution of Purusha and Prakriti to reveal the symbolic meaning of the world. He dives further into the theme of this teaching in a followup satsang which will be revealed to our Members next week…

title: Choose Your Future: Demonic or Divine
description: Shunyamurti outlines the three ranges on the consciousness spectrum we are now left with: from divinized to humanized to demonized. Now is the time to re-connect to Source Power, recharge our energetic batteries and re-divinize consciousness!

title: God’s Ultimate Blessing Is Being Granted
description: Shunyamurti offers a cosmic perspective on global annihilation, reminding us that the end of the world is the ultimate blessing, because the final act reveals the Singularity.

title: Restore Your Freedom of Consciousness
description: Shunyamurti exposes the ego’s original sin: identifying with signifiers passed down by the family system–and staying loyal to that system. We must leave the world of egoic identification that was created by others, and bring to light a new world that is no longer enslaved by signs, but based on freedom, redemption and transcendence.

title: The 5 Elements of Liberation
description: Shunyamurti intertwines the five fundamental elements (Earth, Water, Air, Fire, Ether) with the five patron sages of Sat Yoga and explains the symbolic significance and necessity of each on the journey to Liberation.

title: You Can Bring About Miraculous Healings
description: How do we heal the inner child that has been traumatized by a lifetime of misidentification and defenses? Shunyamurti encourages us to explore this miraculous consciousness that we have been gifted, and to recognize its power and its potential to offer love, to heal ourselves, and to help others.

title: Why Stay in the Ego?
description: Shunyamurti gives a powerful call to kill the ego before it kills you! At the end of this Kali Yuga, we must get out of the imaginary, rise to the symbolic and realize the Real.

title: Don’t Be A Stranger to Your Self
description: In this classic teaching, Shunyamurti outlines the narratives that arise within every ego, and the ultimate understanding required to navigate the heroic journey into unknown.

title: Be Faithful to the Ultimate Event
description: Shunyamurti introduces a documentary film on the life of modern French philosopher, Alain Badiou, with a conversation about transformation and transcendence, the event that gives meaning to being, and philosophy as the mediation of the Real and the phenomenal via the symbolic.

title: Get Out of Your Ego’s Comfort Zone
description: What is Realization? To realize the Real, one must get out of the comfort zone of the mortal body and embody the eternal realization of divine consciousness. Shunyamurti reads from “Thus Spake Ramana.”

title: Suffering is Unnecessary
description: Shunyamurti addresses a question that is asked time and time again, “How do I do it? How does one reach Liberation?” He answers by read excerpts from Muruganur’s “The Shining of My Lord”, a collection of poem and aphorisms about the process of attaining Self-Realization written by a student of Sri Ramana Maharshi.

title: How to Cut the Knot of Angst
description: Shunyamurti explains the difference between a spiritual seeker and a spiritual finder. A spiritual finder has the hunger for spiritual power and increased intelligence that comes from letting go of an ego addicted to illusory pleasure and the unconscious security of pain.

title: Silence the Mental Chatter
description: Shunyamurti lays down a foundational understanding of the path of the Sat Yoga, explaining several of the different paths that lead to the same goal: the Silence of Sat Chit Ananda.

title: The Path of Gnostic Love
description: Shunyamurti invites us to ruminate on the Real Self—with devotion, divine love, and nonduality—the work and play of Self-realization that brings healing and joy.

title: Your Potential is Infinite
description: Shunyamurti begins this powerful teaching with a question: Where do you wish to abide for eternity? The moment has arrived to choose your destiny.

title: The Source is Both Personal and Impersonal
description: Shunyamurti addresses the question of the reality of God and the importance of cultivating an authentic relationship to God that is both personal and impersonal–in order to realize that God, the Self, is the only true Reality.

title: What is Atmanology?
description: Shunyamurti explains Atmanology, the method of inner work in Sat Yoga.

title: Connect to the Infinite Mind
description: Shunyamurti offers insight into the maps and modules of reality, helping us to understand that divine intelligence is the source of this dream reality. Now is the moment to awaken to that intelligence that is our own consciousness, to be the solution we are seeking, so we can re-dream this world that is in danger of extinction.

title: The 4 Discourses of the Dao: Zhuangzi Meets Lacan
description: Shunyamurti reads from his translation of the Tao Te Ching, offering an interpretation of how a Taoist sage relates to the world, and then advice on the Tao of speaking with others, a four-level exploration of where Zhuangzi meets Lacan(zi), called: The 4 Te Tiscourses.

title: God is the Game Changer
description: Shunyamurti speaks about the concept of the “game changer” and how it applies to the spiritual path. The ego, like a machine, is controlled by drives that are destined to fail, and the only way to “change the game” and have the chance to succeed is with Love, and that’s just the beginning…

title: A New World is Coming Soon
description: This teaching was given by Shunyamurti on December 21, 2012, the end of the Mayan calendar, but it is still as relevant today as it was then. The world is paralyzed by a global pandemic of egoic consciousness; as it comes to the end of its current era, all are being called upon to let go of the ego, and to fulfill the destiny of our souls–by ushering in the new age, a world transformed by the power of love and truth.

title: Transcending Trauma, Realizing Truth
description: Shunyamurti speaks to transcending trauma through an alchemical process: Face the dark shadow energy and bring it to light through the healing power of love, allowing the wounded ego to die in the fire of transformation, and the true healer to be reborn.

title: What is the superego?
description: Shunyamurti explains the psychoanalytic concept of the superego.

title: The Superposition of World and God
description: In this beautiful morning teaching, Shunyamurti explains how we are living in two dimensions simultaneously – the relative and the Absolute – and that now is the moment to use our intelligence and free will to choose the highest reality, Liberation over illusion, in order to bring the light of the Real to the dark dimension of the unreal.

title: Divine Madness is the Means of Liberation
description: In this excerpt from a White Magic retreat teaching, Shunyamurti shares the wisdom of the Orphic mystery schools, using the examples of magic, muses and divine madness to help us to understand the journey from ego self to archetypal self, and the soul’s capacity for redemption by raising its vibrational level of consciousness.

title: Bring the World to a Blissful Conclusion
description: Shunyamurti addresses the big picture, giving an overarching context for the current state of the world and the transformational imperative to rise in consciousness. He connects the dots on what is necessary to awaken the world: to reconnect to the Absolute.

title: Freedom Means No Illusions
description: Healing is the result of three elements: Power, Truth, and Love. In this teaching, Shunyamurti helps us understand how to attain complete healing through the understanding that everything one perceives is a projection, and that both the good and bad must be retracted to return to wholeness.

title: Are You in the Tribe of the Awakened?
description: Shunyamurti calls the planetary tribe to reawaken–and bring beauty, life and love back to our planet–but to reclaim the infinite power that awaits beyond the ego, we must first pass through these current rites of passage and become liberated from karma through the divinization of consciousness.

title: The Transubstantiation of Trauma
description: In answer to the quintessential question of all seekers–why can we not reach silence in practice,and find freedom if this is our essence?–Shunyamurti combines Ramana’s teaching on Chit Jada Granthi with Lacan’s Borromean Knot to create a new kundalini map of consciousness to help us transcend the knot of suffering, and ascend from the trauma of the unreal to the bliss of the Real.

title: Meditation is the Shift from Meaning to Being
description: In this teaching, Shunyamurti describes meditation as an art and a science, a means of shifting consciousness into higher dimensions where one is able to go beyond “normal”, beyond signifiers, and into a core “imperience” of realization that reveals the real meaning of Truth.

title: The Simulation is Now Being Adjusted
description: In this beautiful morning teaching, Shunyamurti explains that the Sat Yoga vow of santosha, contentment, is the basis for Grace, of which there are three forms: Shaktipat, anugraha, and prasad, all of which assist in the termination of the simulation – the dissolution into infinite consciousness.

title: This Dark Age Will Soon Dissolve in Light
description: On the night of Maha Shiva Ratri, Shunyamurti invites us to celebrate the revelation of Truth while the window of opportunity is open to attain the Absolute, on the holiest night of the year, when Shiva descends to offer grace. To help with this ascension, Shunyamurti outlines the 7 stages yogis must accomplish to blast off in Shiva’s rocket ship and merge into the Supreme Sun.

title: Insane With Love: Shunyamurti Interprets Rumi
description: Shunyamurti reads and interprets the Rubais of Rumi: Insane with Love, revealing the main obstacle to Liberation is love for the ego rather than for God, and that moving from reason to radical acceptance is the essential breakthrough to the superconsciousness that is real Love.

title: Awakening from the Ego Illusion is Urgent
description: Shunyamurti teaches that the ego is a limitation of consciousness, and that we must reconnect to the source of power that will enable us to live in Truth and Love and help us gain the courage and freedom to consciously cocreate a reality of meaning-moreness that will reverse the tide of suffering and degradation that currently plagues our collapsing world.

title: The Buddha’s Inconvenient Truth
description: Shunyamurti addresses the triad of desire, satisfaction and remorse, and how to live without suffering. In this teaching, Shunyamurti reads from and interprets the Ashtavakra Gita.

title: A Secular Understanding of the Meaning of Shiva
description: In this Maha Shiva Ratri teaching, Shunyamurti explains Shiva–the meaning, the mythology and the metaphors, the Nataraj and its significance, the female consorts, as well as the 5 acts of Shiva and their relationship to the ego and its dream reality, using an updated version of the Kubler-Ross stages of dealing with death (including the death of a civilization).

title: Dare to Master the Unreal World
description: Shunyamurti poses the fundamental question of ancient Sat Yogis: Is the world real? He invites us to investigate the synchronicities and magical aspects of reality, and phenomena such as past lives and near-death experiences, to discover the infinite potentials of consciousness that have been inadequately understood by modern science, and can only be understood by those who dare to go beyond the matrix of misunderstanding.

title: The Unified Field is the Buddha Mind
description: In this morning teaching, Shunyamurti sums up the human problem today as the loss of the capacity to cooperate, though at the end of this cosmic process, this rupture will bring us back to the rapture of unity; the cancer of the ego that forces the illusion of particularity onto the unified field will be dissolved in the singularity, because as Huang Po reminds us, Buddha Mind is not particular, and by comprehending one’s own Mind, the particularity will dissolve into totality, and all will retu

title: The Psychoanalysis of Myth and the Myth of Psychoanalysis
description: Shunyamurti sheds light on the spiritual journey from the perspectives of Hindu mythology and Lacanian psychoanalysis, metaphorically weaving them into an understanding of the three registers of consciousness (the Imaginary, the Symbolic, and the Real) that ultimately must be recognized as an infinite pillar of light.

title: Demise of the Money God and Return of the Lord of Love
description: In this very poignant teaching, Shunyamurti speaks to the transitional phase we currently face: from the god of money, ruler of egoic imprints, to the God of Love, the saving grace that is the true currency of higher consciousness.

title: Abide in Infinite Intensity
description: Shunyamurti reads from Hongzhi’s “Cultivating the Empty Field”, noting that most of these teachings are not understood by the postmodern ego because of its fragmentation and anxiety, but if one can gain distance from thinking, and maintain a cool, dry mind, we can move from sensory intensity to supersensory intensity and recover our infinite imagination.

title: Withdraw from the Unreal into the Real
description: On the opening night of the Meditation Weekend, Shunyamurti defines Sat Yoga as union with the Real, the Supreme Intelligence that is Sat Chit Ananda. He uses the terms imaginary, symbolic and real to further clarify that this path, through meditation, will lead one to discover what is real and unreal, if one is willing to use the wisdom (gyana) gained to withdraw from the unreal and return to the Real.

title: The Perfect Way to Cope With Information Overload
description: Shunyamurti gives an example of being stuck in a room with a one way mirror that the Atman is looking through with the walls (composed messages from the interpersonal, collective, and intra-personal), how to get out by the transformations of the LSD (Lacking Self-Definition), and the RSE (Real Self Enigma), revealing that the Real Self is paradoxically unattainable and the importance of realizing that you are yourself unattainable.

title: Full Empowerment Requires This Sacrifice
description: In this teaching, Shunyamurti explains that one must sacrifice the inner child – to release the childish ego that refuses to grow up as a result of one’s karma and one’s willingness to remain a victim – in order to gain the capacities of adulthood necessary to become a community of fearless beings based in divine love that can overcome death and transform the world.

title: Planetary Collapse is a Growth Opportunity
description: Shunyamurti directly addresses the global crisis, the destruction of our environment, the possible collapse of the global financial system and the collapse of many nations and political systems in this foreshadowing talk from 2018. He asks, and answers, what is it that we can do about this current situation, as a community and as a culture, and what is the most rational way to respond in these times of global crisis.

title: Sanity is Sovereignty Over the Matrix of Mind
description: Shunyamurti begins by discussing the concept of Swaraja (Self-Sovereignty/Self-Rule), saying that most people have not gained self-control, that we are actually controlled by the ego (by the system), that the only sane thing to do in an insane system is to go through ego death, he then talks about the ancient paths of Hedonism and Asceticism via the lens of Epicurus, , then he goes on to speak about the fall in consciousness since the ancient world (focusing on the feudal system) and the fall to

title: Envision a World Where Real Love Reigns
description: In this opening night retreat teaching, Shunyamurti calls to order the gathering of visionaries and impresses upon all that the time has arrived to reach the crown chakra and reclaim it in the name of Liberation! The real co-vid 19 (that all yogis should catch) is corona vidya, the crown consciousness of supreme knowledge, in which the third eye and heart are both open to the visionary transcendence that comes from silence and surrender to the Supreme One in the name of unity and divine love.

title: Grace is Gained Through Grappling With Desire
description: At the close of the meditation weekend, Shunyamurti offers an uplifting teaching to encourage one to remain on the hero’s journey of liberation through meditation as the inward struggle is illumined by grace that will lead to freedom and mastery, and the divine love that will lead one home to a divine new world order.

title: Bring Joy to the World: Let Your God-Self Shine!
description: In this festive teaching, Shunyamurti explains that the holidays are holy-days, and all of the religions and traditions – Christmas, Hanukah, Diwali to name a few – converge on the one realization that is the true meaning and spirit of all the mythological truths: Now is the time for remembrance and realization of our true nature as the holy light of consciousness that can bring joy to the world, peace on Earth, and divine love to all beings everywhere.

title: The Self Minus Karma Equals Bliss
description: Shunyamurti asks if you realize that here and now you are the unborn Self, which has dreamed the soul vehicle, the body, and the ego, that the ego is incapable of realizing the Self as it has no free will, that it is an object in consciousness, nor the is soul capable, as its only choice is between the Upper and Lower Death Drive, but that the soul does have the capacity to humbly surrender to the Self, which can liberate one from the wheel of karma, from suffering, and this will result in a kar

title: How to Upgrade Human Consciousness
description: Shunyamurti explains what we are doing as an ashram and as a wisdom school, explaining the historical situation that we find ourselves in and how we got here, why there is a need to integrate ancient wisdom and insights from such fields as quantum physics in order to co-create a new world based on divine love and law.

title: From Shame to Shine: The Journey Beyond Desire
description: Shunyamurti explains that every ego is in (or has gone through) a titanic struggle, that desire leads to suffering which transforms into the death drive, that one projects the Self onto objects, but one must move beyond desire (which is embedded in language itself) in order to see the beauty behind reality, converting the scarlet letter of shame into the badge of courage, compassion for others, and reveal the archetypal jewels that shine with love.

title: God’s Great Reset Will Soon Begin
description: In this opening night teaching from The Direct Path: Liberation Now! retreat, Shunyamurti teaches that in this historic moment, meditation is more relevant than ever, and that those who feel they are suffering from a loss of physical freedom are actually being offered an opportunity to go inward instead of outward, and to transcend to a higher level of being at the apparent end of this world, which is actually a return to the rediscovery of our supernatural resources, and that by letting go of b

title: The Science of the Unknowable
description: In giving an introduction to a lecture by Michel Bitbol, Shunyamurti says that it’s important to distinguish three levels of consciousness (Paramashiva, Nirguna Brahman, and Saguna Brahman), explaining downward causation (from virtual to actual) in which ultimate meaningfulness can be infused into the world, and goes on to discuss how orgone energy can produce healing, as well as the integration of information and emotion and the sublimation of these into their highest manifestations as supreme

title: If You Want to Be Eaten by God: Be Delicious!
description: Shunyamurti opens the evening by clarifying the meaning of the Balm of Gilead, dovetailing into the connection between medical and culinary arts and how these fit into spirituality, noting that the ultimate sacrament and purpose of our lives is to be eaten by God, which means no longer trying to hide from God but making yourself delicious to God (loving, truthful) and cultivating a relationship to God so that you can be re-flowered by the blissful penetration of the Absolute.

title: The 7 Siddhis of Shiva: Poetry Made Real
description: In this spontaneous teaching that arose during a question and answer session, Shunyamurti reconfigures a popular ancient symbol in order to map the 7 divine superpowers that are available to those who are willing to be completely present–as the essence of what we are–which unlocks an understanding of the dynamics of creation and will bring forth beautiful expressions of beauty and love in poetic encounters with the divine.

title: Winning the Cosmic Video Game
description: Shunyamurti says that the most cutting edge work right now is being done by the Russian Academy of Science in the department of virtualistics and explains some of their work (e.g.no-longer-existing-matter), then suggests we try a thought experiment and assume that reality is a virtual reality, a video game, and explains the implications and pitfalls of this if true.

title: The Disease With One Cure
description: Shunyamurti asks how does one win this simulation/video game that we find ourselves in and the foe of desire that we must overcome in order to win.

title: Don’t Follow Your Jouissance
description: Shunyamurti discusses Joseph Campbell’s oft-cited line, “Follow Your Bliss”, revealing that the ego interprets this phrase as “follow your jouissance” and that we should instead attain the real bliss of God and surrender the ego-mind that seeks comforts/enjoyments in our real hero’s journey to return to the God.

title: To Be and Not to Be: There is No Question
description: Shunya speaks about the symbolic meaning of Earth Day, speaking of the levels of the body being an animal, the soul being a plant (and the mind being both arborescent and rhizomatic), and the Spirit being a mineral, and by returning to the mineral of Spirit, planting the Godseed will lead to planetary rebirth!

title: Ode to Indifference
description: Shunyamurti reads from Verses on the Perfect Mind from the third patriarch of Chan Buddhism, commenting that the mistake that people make is that they have to think, saying that one should use the mind to reach God but then let go of thought, that the thoughts in the text represent Truth but are not that, that we live with right/wrong value judgments, and that at the end of Kali Yuga we must be in a state of total indifference as the extreme culmination of karma comes, and that we must not judge

title: Science and Spirituality
description: Shunyamurti starts by explaining the difference between contemplation and quantumplation, explaining how science has superseded religion and how we must use the insights of science to elucidate our spiritual knowledge, and he speaks of the balance between theory and practice, finally speaking about the meaning of the Trivium.

title: The Anti-Hero’s Journey: Joseph Campbell’s Myth-Take
description: Shunyamurti comments on the Finding Joe (Campbell) documentary, observing how far consciousness has fallen since the time of Joseph Campbell, speaking to the devolution of the Hero’s Journey and what it consists of in current times, as well as the state of the world, and the urgency that this situation calls for.

title: Upgrade Your Ego’s Operating System
description: Shunyamurti explains the development of the ego structure, using the analogy of a computer operating system, explaining the defenses and weaknesses of a system that was designed at such an early age, and the importance of transcending the operating system and realizing the true Programmer in order to attain real freedom, intelligence, and love.

title: Even Gaia Needs Our Love
description: Shunya begins by saying that God gifts all treasures to those who yearn, then explains that many people begin to conceive of God as the third person (He/She), working through to the second person (Thou) when the relationship has deepened, finally realizing God in the first person (I Am/the Self), he then speaks about how God can only be known via the heart, through love, but egos are as agnostic about love as they are about God because of past experiences and traumas, but that love is the only a

title: Evening Q&A – 08.29.20
description: Shunyamurti answers questions on the meaning of masks, shifting paradigms, the truth of the heart, karma, good and evil, and much more.

title: The Good, the Bad, and the Nondual
description: Shunyamurti reads again from Swami Ramdas, a section called “Work is Worship When it is Done Selflessly”, and speaks about karma yoga, doership, then goes on to discuss the categories of good and bad, analyzing it from the perspective of savior faire, of acting in accord with the whole rather than the part, that the ultimate end of evil is to bring one back to nonduality, to the realization that one is not a doer.

title: The Trikaldarshan Principle: Key to Coherence
description: Shunyamurti reads again from Swami Ramdas, a section entitled, “Pain and Sorrow Purify Your Heart”, which he remarks to be the most incoherent of all of his writings, commenting on and exploring whether or not suffering is inherent or if it is only part of ego nature, noting this back and forth or “wobble” between separation and unity, noting that the problem is that this is a fixation on Chronos time (rather than Kairos or the Aion), which is never able to see the whole picture, and goes on to

title: Don’t Be An Entity
description: Shunyamurti talks about the problems entailed in believing oneself to be an entity, all of the baggage that comes with identification as an object, or desiring objects, and the power to heal and live life fully once that is transcended.

title: Love, Knowledge, and Power: How to Become the Artist of Reality
description: Shunyamurti reads again from Swami Ramdas, a section entitled, “Mysticism in Excelsis”, commenting that God is an artist, and an artist loves his artwork, that consciousness traps itself in created forms, that there’s duality for the creation but not the Creator, that there’s also the ability given to us to interpret the artwork, remarking on the registers of consciousness (Imaginary, Symbolic, Real), that one encounters love, knowledge, and then receives power from God, that maya can be seen as

title: The Greatest Story Never Told
description: Shunyamurti clarifies that while Shiva is called “The Destroyer”, it should actually be the “de-story-er”, focusing on our love for stories, but explaining that the Real is beyond all stories, and that we must return to the Self, which is greater than any story that could ever be told.

title: Mythos: Go Inward and Upward: It’s the End of Time
description: Excerpt: So the bottom line recommendation is to be as completely dedicated to reaching total inner silence and unity with the supreme light and love of the one Self, and no longer identified as a separate being, but able to let the body function in its most healthy way, by not having any karmic implicate energies that would express themselves as symptoms of suffering, any longer, anywhere in the body…

title: Mythos: The Secrets of the Chakra Map
description: It’s from Mythos, the old Joseph Campbell series, and we haven’t seen it in many years—at least as a sangha—and I think that it’s useful to have that information as a reminder of why we’re here, what are we doing, and what’s the context in which we’re doing it. And I think a lot of the contextualization of the particular subject matter (which is that of Kundalini Yoga) is specifically relevant to this moment in history…

title: Un-Mappable Intensity
description: Excerpt: And everyone’s map is an attempt to trump everyone else’s map. But who is the mapmaker? You will never find the mapmaker on any map. And all we’re ever trying to do, is to find the mapmaker. But you cannot find the mapmaker. When you sit and meditate a thought pops into your mind, but who pops it there? Who is the Wizard of Oz behind the curtain who puts the thought in your mind? You take the thought as if you created it, but you find it popping into the mind, don’t you? You didn’t crea

title: The Ego is Being Dismembered—and Its World is Ending Now
description: Excerpt: And so, the ego is the Godself fallen into its own crucifixion, its own dismemberment, which was the metaphor used by the Egyptian spiritual tradition. But that fear of dismemberment remains in our unconscious, and the crucifixion that we suffer for the sins of our parents, in order to be able to love them, and to love the family, and to love the world, that has let each of us down, because of its lack of love—without our realizing that we have let ourselves down by having fallen into a

title: Choose Your Brew: Be Intoxicated With Grace, or Drunk With Delusion
description: Excerpt: And so the best strategy for an ego, if that being is capable of summoning up authentic faith and love for the Source of the creation, the Source of its own capacity for Being, for thinking, for feeling, and for recognizing that its power of life comes from elsewhere than its own subsisting thinking powers, or its animal powers as a body—and when there is that recognition that its most creative moments come from downloading inspirations that come from a higher level of consciousness tha

title: The Capacity to Read Reality Is the Key to Spiritual Growth
description: Excerpt: Psychological growth, and then Atmanalogical development, is based on the deepening capacity to read. We have to learn to read faces, we have to read people, we have to read vibrations, we learn to read situations, we learn how to read events, we learn how to read between the lines of texts, we learn to read the heart. And the more deeply we can read, the more accurately, the more that we are in tune with reality, because all of reality is a message, and within the grand message of the

title: The Lost Zen of Tibet: The Artless Art of Non-Conceptualization
description: Excerpt: There’s only one concept in this approach—only one—and that concept is non-conceptualization. That is the way, that is the goal, that is the practice—nothing else. However, because people came who were influenced by having heard about gradual approaches and religious approaches that involved belief in gods in the form of worship, and all of that, the teachers had to have answers to supply as to why none of that is involved. And so, the literature is really teaching the apprentice teache

title: Overcoming Omnesia: The Revelation of the Real
description: Excerpt: Humans are beings suffering from omnesia. We have forgotten our real history. We have forgotten our real nature. We have forgotten the Source of our being. We don’t know who we are at this moment. But through meditation, we can remember; we can reconnect; we can restore the wholeness of what had been lost. Lost, not just to our understanding, but to our power, our scope, our true habitat, that is not in space or time, but in eternity, and infinity…

title: Cultivating Moral Strength
description: Excerpt: The central existential problem for most beings is a lack of moral strength. And this plagues people at different levels; one is the lack of the strength to stop pretending one believes in one’s ego identity, and all of its self-sabotaging sanskaras..

title: Yoga: Medicine for a Failing System
description: Excerpt: The only medicine for this, of course, is the letting go of all the premises upon which this false consciousness has been based, that has led to this horror of a world, of hatred and distrust, of anxiety, and of having given up all of our original powers of healing, of peace, even the ability to communicate—because no one trusts the word of anyone else—you can receive promises, you can get contracts in writing, you can get every guarantee in the world, and you know the thing is going to

title: Humility Is the Greatest Spiritual Virtue
description: Excerpt: So, God is not going to give you credits for how long you fasted, or how many times you flagellated yourself, or how many hours of extra seva you did—all of that is great and all of your learning and your study and your ability to quote scripture—but none of it will get you to where humility will take you. Humility being the absence of ego. Only that is wanted, only that is necessary.

title: Contain Yourself!
description: Excerpt: All of egoic life centers around a single principle and is made up of the complex elaborations of that principle and all the permutations of relationship to that principle that can emerge from the basic situation of existence. . . . But the principle is that of containment. And the question in every relationship is always who will contain whom? And who will be contained?

title: Meditation Is For Lovers: The Language of Ecstasy
description: Excerpt: Meditation is only for lovers. If you don’t have a deep love for God, you won’t enjoy meditation, and you won’t enjoy life very much—and you won’t be able to discover who you are, because the God you don’t love is your Self. The gods that the ego does love are idols that it worships that don’t bring salvation. So Rumi called out to me today and said, “Why don’t you read some of my poetry?” So, I said “OK, well you know, I can’t deny that you were, as the title of this book says, Insane

title: Is Suffering Necessary for Growth?
description: Excerpt: Before I continue reading from the insights of Abol Hasan, I was recalling that there was one answer I gave during the satsang that deserves amplification and clarification. And it was the question that Kuber asked about whether suffering is necessary, or optional—can we jump on the Dao at any moment and be free? And I said that the suffering is necessary because it’s happening, and it has happened, and therefore it’s predetermined….

title: The Diamond Mind of Desire
description: Excerpt: Alright, let me offer a paradigm shift: I’m gonna call this the Diamond Mind of Desire. Now, the term “diamond mind” is used in Buddhism and other traditions, but I’m going to give a slightly different signification for it. At the ego level, you’ve got four basic emotions that are presentable in public that people tend to alternate: You can be sad, mad, glad, or scad. OK, scad means you’re really “scad” of something—that’s a New York accent for “scared”. . . . But that’s only the, let’s

title: God’s Advice for His Friends
description: Excerpt: A very deep teaching. God claims us, but we cannot claim God, because all the power, all the capital, all the understanding, is on the side of God, who is the doer. But we can surrender the illusion of doer-ship, and thus we will be brought home. “One Bewildered in this Love, is like unto a bird which leaves its nest in search of grain and having found none, cannot find its way back to its nest.”

title: Open the Eyes of the Heart & Purify Your Soul
description: Excerpt: Our practice is the realization of God, as the Self. This can be achieved either through a direct investigation, by bringing the attention to the center of your being, from which all thought emerges—but which is beyond all thought—and abiding there until the obscurations and mental activity completely subside, and one remains in silence, illumination, and liberation from all illusions…

title: Activate Your 4-Will Drive
description: Summary: Shunyamurti explains that we must active our “4-Will Drive” and move beyond ego-consciousness, and then goes on to explain the five sins of the Sikh tradition (Kama, Krodha, Lobha, Moha, and Ahamkar)…

title: The Dystopia Is Over: Preparing for the New Beginning
description: Summary: Shunyamurti says that some people are saying that we’re entering a dystopia, but that we’re actually leaving the dystopia, that we have to be beyond terratoriality (“extraterrtorestials”), that we must be detached from what is dying, that God wants us to achieve independence, goes over eating less in this time, and that the key is inner silence and being in a state of calm proportional to the chaos in Kali Yuga, to not depend on golden metal but golden light…

title: God’s Test: Choose the Corona or the Virus
description: Excerpt: Our job in this ashram is to speak the Truth and to live by the Truth—to live in the Truth, to share the Truth. But, not “the truth” as some intellectual formulation, but the Truth as supreme love, light, power, generosity, understanding, and the power to redream maya, which seems to the ego to be reality, but is illusion. To those who are in maya—illusion—some will be happy to hear the Truth. Some will be angry. Some will be frightened. Some will doubt. Some will be confused. Some will

title: The Blind Spot in Science—and Your Ego
description: Excerpt: Science, in order to understand the objective world, had to sacrifice its subjective knowledge of the consciousness that is in fact projecting that world and treating the objects as if they are self-standing phenomena that exist in their own right, and that science has the ability—through induction, deduction, and abduction—the uses of reason, mathematics, Aristotelian logic—to actually grasp the world, if not in an image, at least in a formula and a theory, and a concept that can be ex

title: Deactivating the Engram of Need
description: Excerpt: The unnatural self (or the ego) is built around an engram: the “engram of need”. When that engram is activated, all bets are off: the ego is capable of anything. Around that engram, as protective shells, are two outer spheres. The outermost one we could call “stimulus”, and the second one we could call “signal”. If one becomes aware of a stimulus, it is a very soft indication that there is, in the neighborhood, the possibility of an engram of need being activated. And that can be dealt

title: Reading the Book of the Universe
description: Excerpt: All we do, constantly, in every moment, is to read. But do we understand what it means to read? We do not just read books, we read one another’s faces. We read the energy field. We read the auras. We read our dreams. We are constantly reading, and reading is tracking. We name our cars as “trackers”, as “pathfinders”, and what are we trying to find? Our fortune. So, we name them “Fortuner”. There’s no accident in any of this. But what are we on the track of, and what kind of fortune are

title: Otherness: The Essence of Ecstasy
description: Excerpt: The Self can only be realized as otherness. And this is what is so frustrating to the ego—because can you ever capture otherness? But is otherness real? Or is it an illusion? Is there really any otherness, except from the perspective of an illusory other? And isn’t the definition of the ego, simply consciousness captured in the gaze of an other?And therefore, liberation can only be the recognition that there is another other, in whose gaze you live. Beyond the gaze of any particular oth

title: The 7 Equivalences that Liberate
description: Well, you’re not born knowing what your face looks like; you’ve got to look in a mirror. But the real mirror that you look into is the one in your Well, you’re not born knowing what your face looks like; you’ve got to look in a mirror. But the real mirror that you look into is the one in your Well, you’re not born knowing what your face looks like; you’ve got to look in a mirror. But the real mirror that you look into is the one in your

title: All Representations of Reality Are False
description: Excerpt: That which is quaintly referred to as “God” is consciousness released from representation, into the realm of pure bliss. Bliss trumps representation. The ego develops as a pre-representational consciousness, which means that it has no tools with which to bind its affects—and unbound affects produce suffering. That is why the infant requires maternal containment—the mother’s job is to contain and bind the negative affects, in particular, with a conceptual and affective energy field, in w

title: The Power of Mythlessness
description: Excerpt: Recently, I was looking for more doc [documentary] films to show, and I went through the list of those on my computer, and found again the old Joseph Campbell series, The Power of Myth, and checked out a bit of it, and disagreed with nearly everything I was hearing him say. And I realized that Sat Yoga is the power of mythlessness. And that “faith” can be defined as the refusal to buy into any myth. To be faithful to the Truth, which will never submit to a mythology.

title: The Sense & Nonsense of Nonduality
description: Excerpt: No credit, no blame. Did you have a choice to think you are who you think you are? And thinking who you are, could you really choose to be anyone else? The definition of “sense” is that which we once thought of as nonsense. The definition of “nonsense” is that which we once thought made sense…

title: How Higher Order Will Emerge From the Current Chaos
description: Excerpt: There is a real, true power that saves us from the suffering that seems to be apparently destroying the world. And when we recognize the Real that is indestructible, behind and within the illusion, we will be able to remain at peace, and to offer peace that is authentic, that will enable those who are suffering, whether physically or emotionally, to enter into a higher vibrational frequency that will bring the balm of love, and of the joy of knowing that one is in the protective energy

title: Vibrational Dynamics of Meditation
description: Excerpt: In the beginning, meditation may seem difficult, and that you are trying to swim upstream against a tide of thought that wants to keep you in an externalized, body-identified, small, helpless, egoic, frame of reference. But at some moment, a non-ordinary event will occur, in which you realize that you are not the one meditating, but that you are being meditated. You are being meditated by a power greater than the you that you think you are….

title: Let Go of the Ego’s Desire to Talk
description: Excerpt: Sat Yoga is consciousness realizing itself. It is consciousness from which all illusion has fallen away. This includes the illusion of multiplicity, the illusion of a world, the illusion of an ego, the illusion that there is anything but consciousness. And thus, what falls away in that realization is all attempt to interpret reality, because reality is understood as only consciousness at play with itself. And so, there are no Sat Yogis, and there is no one who attains realization of the

title: Transform Your Mind Into a Clear Mirror
description: Excerpt: “If one insists that in this experience he still has a distinct individuality, such an assertion arises only through the limited knowledge of those pundits or teachers who are bound to the false.” In other words, religious teachers who are bound to teach dogma. “But the form of jivanmuktas is the space of consciousness which is the clean mirror that reflects whatever is placed before it. The individuality that seems to exist for these, is only the reflection of the individuality of thos

title: The Field of Consciousness is Aware of Itself
description: Excerpt: Consciousness exists as a spectrum. At the lowest and densest level of the spectrum there seems to be a multiplicity of individual, personal consciousnesses. And in the middle of the spectrum there seems to be a struggle of consciousness to extract itself from the illusion of the person, and as that extraction becomes more complete, there is an imperience of shakti, of divine energy that seems to fill the consciousness from its own beyond. But at the unchanging Source of consciousness,

title: Ramana’s Warning About False Forms of Bliss
description: Excerpt: This morning, the Lord Shiva wanted me to read some lines from a teaching by our patron saint, Sri Ramana, which I’m always happy to do, and I think it’s very important to return to the horse’s mouth—the Gau Mukh, the cow’s mouth, is probably more appropriate—to hear the words that describe the solution to all problems. I’ll start on page 78 of a collection of teachings of Ramana, called Padamali, collected by Muruganar. This section is called “The Bliss of the Self”…

title: The Paradox of Emptiness
description: Excerpt: Sat Yoga can only begin when the yearning to know the Self has reached a level of intensity that one is willing to pursue relentlessly, ruthlessly, un-intermittently, the truth of one’s Being.And in that pursuit of the Self, that investigation, that need for discovery of what is Real, Sat Yoga becomes an empirical science of consciousness. But what is discovered in that science is that the Self cannot be known. There can be no “science of the Self” because the Self cannot know itself as

title: The Alchemy of White Magic
description: Excerpt: Sat Yoga is the path of white magic. Are you on the path to become a white magician?Magic begins with the unification of the opposites—the alchemists call it coincidentia oppositorum. The archetype of the Sat Yogi in the West is Christ, who said, “Let thine eye be single and thy whole body shall be filled with light.”…

title: Yoga is Commitment to the Real
description: Excerpt: One becomes a real yogi, a Sat Yogi, by determining to live in Truth and by fulfilling that determination. And the determination to live in Truth means to kill the tendency to want to live in untruth, which is called the ego. And because untruth is a form of deadness, the yogi kills off the deadness within so that what remains is the living Truth, and the living Truth is the Truth of the Present—the eternal Presence, the present as pure Consciousness…

title: The 3 Forces That Guide Consciousness
description: Excerpt: And through the belief of that form being a world, the conditions of time and space and matter and energy became configured by consciousness, that then became a space for the working out of the karma of the person. But the consciousness is not a person, nor a body, nor a piece of matter, or even energy, and once that is understood then none of the supposed qualities—either of the material form or of the personality, the karma, the history of that person’s biography—have anything to do w

title: Surrender to Mastery of the Mystery
description: Excerpt: Mastery is simply surrender—and surrender simply means getting the illusion of the ego out of the way so that that clarity of consciousness may ensue.  The process of yoga cannot begin in earnest until one recognizes that consciousness is a mystery—that you don’t know who you are—you are in the process of discovering that. But who you think you are is simply a fiction—a narrative based upon projections that are residues of the past and have no present viability or truthfulness…

title: The Sattvic Solution
description: Excerpt: A Sat Yogi is someone who has chosen the sattvic solution. The solution to what? To the problem of how to deal with the set of delusions that constitute maya. Those delusions are not neutral, theoretical errors of course, they are delusions that are accompanied by very painful emotions, affects, symptoms, impulses, and, all too often, harmful behavior…

title: Livestream Satsang 10.27.19
description: Topics covered in this teaching:

title: Being is Grace: The End of Karma
description: Excerpt: Being is grace. We receive grace very easily just by returning to our Being. The ego is that aspect of consciousness dissociated from Being—split off from Being into thinking and, through identification with its vehicle, into doing. Thinking and doing are the hell realms. Being is the realm of grace…

title: The Past Doesn’t Matter
description: Excerpt: And through the belief of that form being a world, the conditions of time and space and matter and energy became configured by consciousness, that then became a space for the working out of the karma of the person. But the consciousness is not a person, nor a body, nor a piece of matter, or even energy, and once that is understood then none of the supposed qualities—either of the material form or of the personality, the karma, the history of that person’s biography—have anything to do w

title: The Ego Moth Must Burn in the Blissful Flame
description: Excerpt: And yet the moth orbits around the flame and doesn’t go into it for some time, because it knows at some other level that there is destruction, pain, the agony of its own death, and yet it cannot but continue to be drawn into the light. And as it gets closer to the light, its love grows in accord with its fear, and the love and the fear become one, and at some point the moth cannot live without becoming one with the flame. And in that moment that the moth enters the flame and that its wi

title: Derrida, Tillich, Ramana: The Revolution Continues (as the Call of the Unconditional)
description: Excerpt: So, tonight’s subject will concern Derrida, Tillich, and Sri Ramana as our two postmodern foils for Ramana’s teaching—and perhaps we can say predecessors and “prefiguration-ists”: The Revolution Continues as the Call of the Unconditional…

title: From Meaning to Truth: From Duality to Nonduality
description: Excerpt: And so to shift from meaning to Truth is to shift from duality to nonduality. And once that shift is made then what happens immediately is that one loses all fear, because what all fear comes down to is the fear of the other’s projection upon oneself, as being unworthy of existence. It is this fear of the projection of the other that can lead to rejection, abandonment, and all of the other existential consequences that are so terrifying to the individual ego that can only be surmounted

title: There Are No Gyanis, Only Gyana
description: Excerpt: Sri Ramana was very emphatic about the core teaching that he came to transmit, which is that there are no gyanis—there is only gyana. Have you taken in the implications of that teaching? What is gyana except knowledge? Supreme knowledge. What is that knowledge? It is that nothing is except pure Awareness. There is no world, there are no persons, there is no ego, there is no suffering—none of it that is part of the story that the ego-mind tells itself has any reality…

title: How to Contemplate the Infinite
description: Excerpt: We come together to contemplate God. This in itself is a great honor and privilege that one’s own intelligence is drawn to the act of the contemplation of the reality of God.But how does one begin to contemplate the infinite intelligence, the infinite love, the infinite imagination, the infinite power of God? Can your mind even attempt to grasp a reality from which our own minds are derived, but contain only such a slight—it is an immeasurable amount of the intelligence of the Presence,

title: The Universe Dreams Itself
description: Excerpt: The one thing no one thing no one wants to lose is consciousness, that’s why there is fear of death, and yet the ego doesn’t know that death actually liberates the consciousness back into its infinite dimensionality, and that the ego itself is the death of real consciousness, that is forced into a dungeon of fantasies of inadequacy of desire and fear of what is only its own phantasm that has no reality whatsoever, nor does the ego’s own identity, except as a dream within a dream within

title: What Myths Are You Living Under?
description: Shunyamurti states that we must return to Truth, that we see through the falsity of the historical and political narratives/myths, but we must recognize we live in a family myth, and then goes through how this is expressed at different assemblage points, the narrative and counter narrative (“They did their best”), reaching the Viveka Point and going into the Nothingness to ultimately return the world to a paradise of Truth.

title: Drink the Nectar
description: Excerpt: In the early morning meditation, yogis come, like bees, to drink the nectar of the supreme Presence. By silencing the mind, we are filled with the love of God. And the power of that love produces nectar in the third eye that drips continually into the heart, filling us with joy, with peace, with satisfaction, with the fulfillment of the realization of the supreme power. And that power is assimilated so that we realize our oneness with it. And the body and the mind become instruments of

title: The Sadhana of the Sat Yogi
description: Excerpt: One cannot awaken from the dream by anything that the dream-person does within the dream. Whether what that person does is to pray to God—which is nothing other than a projection of “I Am I”—and therefore cannot reach the God that the ego believes in. Or whether one does any kind of sadhana whatsoever, other than that of paying immediate, direct attention to the Self, within, beyond the mind….

title: Silence Solves All
description: Excerpt: And we tend to underestimate the power of silence, because an ego is not capable of silence. It knows nothing of silence. It knows nothing of peace, because it knows nothing of the Real. And cannot know, because it is only through the dissolution of that mental construct, that the Real is revealed….

title: Truth: The Power That Liberates
description: Excerpt: Thanks to the sheer power of the liberating Truth, revealed by Bhagavan Sri Ramana, the Maharishi, those old souls who are of the level of maturity, who are able to hear this knowledge, will be impacted so directly, that the eye of Wisdom within is literally forced open, and the awakening of the heart takes place, regardless of the resistances remaining in the ego….

title: Understanding Happiness and the Role of a Guide
description: Excerpt: Bhagavan Sri Ramana Maharishi, speaking as the Sat Guru, in the first line of the first writing declares, “All living beings seek happiness, always. ”Today we’ll focus just on human beings. The reason why we seek happiness always, is that we know deep within, and sometimes feel, our real nature, which is the most extreme and infinite happiness. And the most infinite wisdom and understanding, and that this state is the true nature of all that is…

title: The Mirage or the Real: Choose
description: Behind the illusory moving mind of the ego, the Self—your Self—is always in that silent stillness of absolute peace. Absolute bliss that never wavers. A yogi is one who is dedicated to realizing the Self, the Real. And abide in that state of the unmoving stillness that is God-consciousness. Nothing more, nothing less…

title: Is Ashram Life For Me?
description: The question is: Who would be happy in an ashram? Not very many. Because the mission of an ashram goes against the grain of every ego. It’s the renunciation of the ego. That’s the whole purpose of being in a place like this—and no ego wants to renounce itself…

title: Supreme Peace is Available Now
description: Sat Yoga is the path of the discovery of the Self, for those who seek the Source of our being, the Source of consciousness, which is the Source of all that is. Because in the Source, alone, all the problems of the multiplicity are resolved; it is the path to that from which the thought of “I” arises. But the thought is secondary and cannot arise except through the emanation of that which it represents…

title: The Self is Supreme Consciousness
description: Chaitanyam Atman. These are words from the Shiva Sutras, meaning that the Self is Supreme Consciousness.Supreme Consciousness means total, Absolute Consciousness. Without blind spots. Without limitation. Pure consciousness means without any blemishes. And the main blemish is the ego. The ego-mind with its negative, ungodly thoughts….

title: Silence is Grace
description: The sacred, inmost silence is the grace of God. It lifts the burden of the illusion of individual existence. It eliminates the suffering ego and all of its anxieties. It dissolves the boundaries between inner and outer, between God and man. It brings peace….

title: Receiving the Power of Shiva
description: Be not discouraged. Continue to persevere in your atma vichara, and do not believe any despairing thoughts of the ego-mind.\nAnd by keeping the faith that you are not the ego, but you are the Self—now—Shiva will contact you through the third eye, and you will begin to sense its illumination. And simply through focus on the reception of that energy, which will come with a distinct power, that enables the consciousness that focuses upon it to become silent. And the stronger is the attention upon t

title: The Outside is the Inside
description: The great work of transformation can be achieved either from the outside in or the inside out.The ordinary approach is from the outside in. It’s ordinary because the ordinary illusion is that there is an outside world. It’s that illusion itself that is being transformed…

title: The Proof of the Spiritual Warrior
