description: It is the totality of the lostness of the consciousness at that moment of truth, that is the proof of the greatness of the spiritual warrior, who has the power of that humility, that knows only in its own sacrifice can it find that core of undefiled consciousness, that will enable an ascension of its mind from its own hell realm into a state of peace, a state of freedom from unbearable terrors, beyond anything that could be called a mere worry or a fear, but a dread that is nameless, unspeakable

title: The Real Self vs. the False Self
description: Sat Yoga means the discovery of the Real Self, the discovery of that Self, and the establishment in and as that Self, and the complete realization of all that the Self is. All those who have attained the realization of the Self declare that it is the fulfillment of life; that, in fact, life does not begin until the Real Self is known…

title: Becoming a Gyana Siddha
description: All that exists is Shiva. All that ever was, or ever shall be, is the One Consciousness, the One Supreme Intelligence, whose love manifests as worlds without end. Without end, without beginning, and yet with moments of punctuation, in which Truth is revealed, from the midst of the illusion that the world becomes when it is overlaid with the illusion of the ego…

title: Invest in the Real Self
description: The ego itself is an investment. It’s a particular kind of investment that your parents made in your mind. In your body’s way of adapting to society’s demands—which were their demands—including the subconscious demand to oppose their demands. And once one was invested in this investment that had been made in one’s ego, and one ratified that investment, then the ego went on to make a series of other investments, in objects that would remind it of the original investments…

title: The Pure Space of Gyana
description: True gyana is Nirgun. It is the attribute-free space of pure awareness. It is beyond all qualities. And is neither subject nor object. This space of complete and total purity is the abode, the source, and the power point of the Self…

title: The Time of Moola
description: This is the time of the Moola. Not the “mula” that’s the euphemism for money—that time is almost over. Not the Mullah Nassr Eddin of the Sufi fame, although moola is quite relevant as a crazy fool. But moola is root. Muladhara. The root. We are at the time when we are reaching the root. Two roots, really, simultaneously. One is the root of ignorance. And the other is the root of the Real….

title: Where Does Your Loyalty Lie?
description: May we think very deeply about our loyalty to the ego and its identifications with all the small others in one’s life, and all of the false big Others, that have replaced your love for God, that have taken the place of your realization of who you really are. That have caused you to act in ways that increase the suffering of the world, rather than its peace, its joy, its beauty, its love, its purity of heart…

title: Transformation Comes From Divine Love
description: The first commandment given to the children of Israel in the Torah, is that, “Thou shalt love the Lord Thy God with all thy heart, all thy soul, all thy might.” But can you command love? Can love be demanded by anyone? Does not that love have to emerge directly from your own heart for God, not because of a commandment? And a commandment from a being that the ego cannot know, cannot understand, cannot actually believe in, until God’s love has been felt within one’s own heart…

title: How to Gain True Power
description: Are you transmitting that power? Have you chosen to be one of the powerful ones, rather than one of the weak ones? Have you made that decision to be the right hand of God? To be the real Hanuman. Have you made that decision, to serve Rama, not mammon, not Satan, to serve the Real, not the false? Have you made that decision to honor your true nature, to honor the God within? To live as a being of light and love, not as one of fear and desire and moral perversion. Have you made that decision? Beca

title: Nitya Shuddha Buddha Mukta
description: Sri Ramana would often quote from the Upanishads, the great mahavakya that describes the Atman using four terms: Nitya, Shuddha, Buddha, Mukta. This means that the nature of the Atman, the nature of the Self, the one Self, is eternal, nitya, timeless; beyond the illusion of time, never subject to it….

title: How to Get Satisfaction
description: A Sat Yogi is one who has renounced the habit of unhappiness.Have you renounced that bad habit?That bad habit is also known as the ego. The ego is a state of perpetual dissatisfaction because the ego is dissatisfied with itself. And, of course, it projects its shadow out as its world, and becomes unhappy with its world, with its situation. But it knows that no matter how it changes the situation, it will remain unhappy…

title: Into the Ultimate Mystery…
description: May we have the intelligence to say “yes” to what is being offered, and take the journey into the Ultimate Mystery to discover who we are, and of what we are capable of dreaming into manifestation…

title: The Ego’s Mortal Enemy
description: This Supreme Intelligence, has imagined archetypal forms of beauty; of carriers of this Intelligence, into a world of infinite possibility; of the application of creative intelligence, in a context of multiplicity. But that multiplicity is a union, because all beings are linked by and within the matrix of this Supreme Intelligence….

title: The Struggle of Freedom and Fear
description: In the statue of Nataraj, one leg is on the dwarf, and one is raised. The foot that’s on the dwarf, teaches us about the heaviness of karma, when we are resistant to the presence of God or in the illusion of a separate existence. Then we will feel the resistance of the material world that we have mistakenly conjured up into being, that will resist us, and our intentions, or bring them a futility, to a point of diminishing returns, to the recognition of the vanity of the human being, and its ulti

title: The Key to Liberation: Coherence
description: The key to liberation is coherence. If you take an ordinary light bulb, its rays will shine in all directions, incoherently. That incoherence has a value—you get to see the whole room. But you don’t get to break through the space of that room, as you would if you were able to make all of those light rays coherent, and turn the beam into a laser. And if you had a powerful enough laser beam you could burn and hole in the wall and get out of the room. Lasers create coherent light. Meditation create

title: The Power of Freedom Lies in Claiming It Now
description: The same blissful Self resides in every physical organism here, and resides transcendent of all, and containing all of this, and produces this electromagnetic field, in which we all share a unified energy. Can you feel this boundary-less, boundless, unified wholeness, that we constitute as an apparent many-ness, that has discovered its Oneness?

title: The Essential Function of an Avatar
description: A Sat Yogi is one who realizes being an avatar of that Supreme Essence. And because you are a manifestation of that Supreme Intelligence, that transcends time and space, the Self that you are is untouched by events that occur in spacetime, in the waking dream. Because you are the Dreamer of this bardo of the dream, of the cosmos, you cannot be afflicted by any of its conflicting events…

title: The Cosmic Kumbhaka
description: The universe breathes itself towards its own final cosmic kumbhaka, in which all change stops even at the circumference. And the center emerges from nowhere to everywhere, and reveals that infinite potential, to be present even in the midst of hopelessness and darkness and deadlock and destruction, until it is clear to every living point of consciousness, that the One Self that has breathed life into it, is eternal, and victorious in such a way that cannot be pre-judged by any mind…

title: The Real Self is Pure Paradox
description: From the perspective of human logic and language, the Self is total paradox. And once the Self is realized, then everything is realized as being paradoxical. But the Self is the source of paradox and the reason why paradox rules over Aristotelian logic, and, therefore, why anything is possible…

title: Churn the Ocean of Consciousness—But Don’t Swallow the Poison!
description: So the core mythological structure of yoga is expressed in the myth of the Samudra Mantan. . . . You remember, Ananta the snake is used around Mount Meru, and one side is pulled by the devas, and the other by the asuras, and this battle, this “tug of war” between them ends up churning the ocean…

title: The Magic of Liberation
description: But whose power of love and of creative joy produces a dream-field of harmonious play, and ongoing divine growth, into ever higher levels of wisdom, and of the spontaneous development of the power of magic? It is the magical dimension of the dream-field, that is the specialty of the Sat Yogi….

title: The Origin and Essence of Community
description: If we look back at the history of Kali Yuga society and culture, we discover that every civilization began as a small community.And every small community began as a school: A spiritual wisdom school. And very often the wisdom school would be accompanied by a sister school, which would be a mystery school. And these two often would function together, and sometimes separately….

title: The Entheojective Perspective
description: To be a Sat Yogi is to have made a shift in one’s register of consciousness.One no longer functions from the egocentric level of the consciousness, but from the theocentric. One no longer leads a human life, but a divine life, a Godly life.It is no longer a life of ordinary subjectivity. Nor of mere objectivity. One could say it is a life of “entheojectivity”….

title: The Self is Knowledge
description: The Self is knowledge: Absolute knowledge. And the process of Sat Yoga is simply the transformation of ignorance into knowledge. But the knowledge that is the Self, is not knowledge mediated by language, or concepts, or images, or affects. It is direct knowledge of the Real, and direct knowledge—gyana, gnosis, direct knowledge—is knowledge without ego, a knower, or a known, because knowledge knows that there is no knower—and there is no known…

title: How to Activate Your Mirror Neurons
description: It is this that meditation achieves: the restoration of the true nature of the Self prior to the initial toxic identifications from the family system. And it is this purification of the toxicity of consciousness that then allows the luxury of activating the mirror neurons without danger, without confusion, without empathy becoming another form of oppressive identification…

title: Relative Life & Absolute Life
description: A yogi is one who learns to value life, and who can discern the difference between a relative life and Absolute life. The yogi knows all too well that a relative existence is temporary, short, fleeting. And that its only value lies in manifesting Absolute life. Eternal life. To convert the temporal into the eternal is yoga?

title: The Three Mantras of Sat Yoga
description: The three mantras of Sat Yoga represent symbolically the three principles that must be mastered by consciousness in order to realize its full potential—and to activate all of those powers that are required for the transformation of destiny.So, we can say that the first principle, the Om Namah Shivaya…

title: Realizing the Gift of Consciousness
description: The world is now moving out of a period in which the hegemonic ideology was that of materialism. And because of the advent of quantum physics and other contemporary sciences, it has become clear that it makes more sense to understand the fundamental stuff of the universe is not matter because matter is derivative from quantum wave functions, and they are derivative of a unitive quantum field that is not material, that is recognized by science as that which constitutes consciousness itself…

title: Are You Ready for Real Life?
description: Your nature is freedom that cannot be taken away or lost. The identity of the ego that has lost its freedom, was never you, was never real, was always empty of any inherent existence or essence. It was an appearance but not a reality. The life of the ego is a dream. There is much to be learned from the dream, but the real learning begins at the moment of awakening from the dream.

title: Dropping the Delusion of Me
description: Sat Yoga is the irrevocable gift of the “I”, the “me”, and the “mine”, to the Supreme Absolute Consciousness. Have you given that gift? Until that gift has been given—irrevocably—one cannot be considered a yogi. In exchange for that gift, one receives the Supreme and Absolute Consciousness, in exchange. And one receives freedom from one’s past, from one’s traumas, from one’s limitation, from all of one’s self-images, from all of the patterns of misbehavior, and from all of the forms of suffering

title: Portal to the Primordial
description: A Sat Yogi is one who abides in Paramdham, the Supreme State, also known as Mukti Dham, the abode of the liberated.\nHave you all found your way to Paramdham? Do you know the way?\nIt is a secret way. But the secret is known to all traditions. But it is known only conceptually. And one cannot get there with concepts.

title: Nirgun & Sagun Brahman
description: The Real, in the Vedic metaphysical system, is called Brahman. Brahman is nondual absolute presence. And yet, if Brahman is nondual, why do they teach that there are two levels of Brahman? They speak of Nirgun Brahman, and Sagun Brahman. How is that possible?

title: Awaken From the Dream of the Universe
description: Your nature is freedom that cannot be taken away or lost. The identity of the ego that has lost its freedom, was never you, was never real, was always empty of any inherent existence or essence. It was an appearance but not a reality. The life of the ego is a dream. There is much to be learned from the dream, but the real learning begins at the moment of awakening from the dream.

title: The Self Pervades All
description: Bhagvan Uvacha. In the Bhagavad Gita, the key sentence is spoken by the Lord God who animates the body of Sri Krishna. And he says, “All beings abide within me. But I do not abide within them.”\nDo you understand the significance of this statement by God?

title: Becoming a Maharishi
description: Sat Yogis are those who have received a great boon. They have received the grace of God because of their surrender to God. And this grace gives them the gift of sight; the gift of being a rishi, or even a Maharishi.\nThe rishi is one who can see the Truth; who can see the One Self, pervading the many; who sees the infinitesimal spiraling out into the infinite, instantaneously, as the emanation of all worlds, all dreams, all manifest forms, and yet remains always invisible, except to the sight of

title: The Miracle of Consciousness
description: Consciousness is the great miracle. Most people take the miracle for granted. And most remain at the very surface of consciousness without ever exploring its depths; without ever wondering: “What is consciousness really capable of?”\nWe do not learn to use the gift that we are given. And in the modern age, the intelligence that has been used has focused only on the objective aspect of consciousness: it is focused only on the manipulation of what has been quaintly called “matter”, without fully u

title: False Consciousness: Then and Now
description: In the 19th century, Western civilization discovered that it was living in false consciousness, and we begin to have the appearance of literary stories such as Jekyll and Hyde and The Portrait of Dorian Gray and other literary productions that came out of the Romantic movement that portrayed this split consciousness and came with the recognition that we were not masters over our own motivations, over our own bodies, over our own understanding of reality, and that there were levels of consciousne

title: “El Hombre Propone, Dios Dispone”
description: The old cliché “El hombre propone y Dios dispone” [“Man proposes, God disposes”] is an eternal truth. No matter how much effort we make to achieve anything, especially in the spiritual field, success is owed to the grace of God, not to human effort. And the outcome of whatever we do, no matter how well planned, can never be guaranteed. But only the Will of God will determine the destiny of our actions and our existence..

title: Melting Into the Flame of Being
description: Meditation is when no one does nothing. But to get to the point of realizing you are no one requires absolute focus on the consciousness that is seeking to discover its own essence and discovers only emptiness. But in that discovery, the conditions of existence are altered through the slowing down of metabolic processes and of thought processes that in turn slow down time and enable a deepening of awareness to attain the source of the very will to know the self and to melt back into that origina

title: The Fall of Greatness
description: The time of the ego is over. This is a historic reality. There are no more great egos.Once upon a time in Kali Yuga, the goal of life was to become a great man or a great woman, and there was even a theory that the great man made history. There are no longer great men or great women. There are no longer great artists. There are no longer great thinkers. There are no longer great saints or sages..

title: The Journey Beyond Meaning
description: The Real is blissful because it is formless and other-less and because it is beyond meaning and beyond any sense of “I”, and those are the criteria of purity of consciousness that has been decontaminated of duality. For the ego consciousness—for that very low level of awareness and intelligence that inhabits a phantasmatic realm of multiplicity—there cannot be bliss, but the ego functions in terms of its relationship between jouissance and meaning.

title: Meditation is De-Reification
description: Reification comes from the Latin word res, which means “thing”. The modern age is characterized and often identified with the work of Rene Descartes in the 1600s, who began his meditations with the understanding that the soul, the consciousness, is res cogitans, a thinking thing. As soon as that presupposition was made of being a thing, then there was no way out of the conceptualization of a world of things and of thing-hood as the basic principle of reality.

title: Preparing for the Phase Transition
description: DescriptionTranscriptionDownloads Excerpt: The word “Sandhya” refers to a phase transition. It’s one of the important concepts in yogic psychology, that it’s very important to be in a meditative state during any phase transition, because things are changing at a very rapid rate. Not only in the morning do the bats go to sleep and the […]

title: No Artificial Ingredients
description: A Sat Yogi is consciousness without artificial ingredients. It is the removal of everything artificial within consciousness. That is the work of the sadhana of the Sat Yogi: to realize consciousness as it is in itself, in its purity; consciousness without any imported ingredients or without the belief that there is anywhere from which ingredients could be imported; consciousness independent of thought forms, unattached to thought forms, including thought forms that are projected as external othe

title: The True Practice of Sat Yoga
description: The true practice of Sat Yoga is the cessation of all mental activity while abiding in the highest center of consciousness. It is that cessation, stillness, that removes all interference patterns and all differentiation—between the attention that is abiding, and that power in which the consciousness is enveloped and there is a merging into God Consciousness—that can remain as the Truth of our Being, but can remain so only if there has been achieved prior to that, a complete purification of thoug

title: Understanding The Third Eye
description: Student Question: What is the “Third Eye”?

title: The Meaning of the Cross
description: Shunyamurti explains the symbolic meaning of the Cross.

title: The Subconscious Affects Karma
description: Student Question: How does karma interact with the subconscious traumas and drives?

title: How Do I Deal With Backlash?
description: Student Question: How do I deal with backlash?

title: Stronger Ego or Silence?
description: Student Question: I have noticed that I avoid going into the silence. Should I go into silence or work on developing a stronger ego?

title: What is Morphic Resonance?
description: Student Question: What is “morphic resonance”?

title: What Is the Imagination?
description: Student Question: What is imagination?

title: How Can We Change the World?
description: Student Question: How can we change the world?

title: Does the Soul Want Death?
description: Student Question: Does the desire for death come from the soul?

title: Body Care After Enlightenment?
description: Student Question: Will I continue to look after my body if I achieve Liberation?

title: How to Understand the Buddhi
description: Student Question: What is the buddhi?

title: What Are the End Times?
description: Student Question: What are the end times?

title: Are All Types of Guilt Unhealthy?
description: Student Question: Is all guilt unhealthy?

title: Meditation and Higher Consciousness?
description: Student Question: Is meditation the only way to higher states of consciousness?

title: The Link Between Sacrifice & Vairagya
description: Shunyamurti speaks about the relationship between sacrifice and vairagya (dispassion).

title: Understanding Desire and Lack
description: Shunyamurti speaks about desire, lack, and going beyond desire to the Self.

title: Restoring the Aryastocracy
description: Shunyamurti speaks about the loss of nobility in culture and how we must return to that nobility of spirit.

title: The Final Stages of the Path
description: Shunyamurti gives a detailed explanation of the path from the Trivium to the Quadrivium, explaining all of the steps along the way.

title: You Can’t Fake It If You Want to Make It
description: Shunyamurti talks about the performativity paradox and about how one must do the inner work and move beyond faking spiritual progress.

title: What Myths Are You Living Under?
description: Shunyamurti states that we must return to Truth, that we see through the falsity of the historical and political narratives/myths…

title: The Value of Virtuous Community
description: Shunya describes the gift of living in a community of real yogis, of the way a community should be, of the power of a community, and the gift of living in this (Sat Yoga) community.

title: Language & The Murder of the Self
description: Shunyamurti describes the acquisition of language as the repression of the (Real) Self, describing the process of exclusion involved in language, the first case being the I-thought, about the psychotic delusions involved in language and the ego structured by language, the radical evil that is the mother tongue, and how the only way to help the world is through eliminating the languaged ego because otherwise we are on the side of the Death Drive.

title: The Practice of Radical Freedom
description: Shunyamurti speaks of Sat Yoga as the practice of freedom, of how the teachings are not to be taken as belief but to as tools to achieving freedom, and how it is useful to seek the help of an expert who can help you achieve that freedom, and speaks in very general terms about the complication of the spiritual path/journey to freedom that is created by the unconscious.

title: Dealing with Obstacles in Meditation
description: Two questions taken from satsang with Shunyamurti.\nQuestion 1: In meditation how do I deal with anxiety and unpleasant feelings that I don’t understand?\nQuestion 2: How do I let go of a repetitive thought in meditation?

title: Realize That Liberation is a Choice
description: Shunyamurti speaks about turning desire into discernment which opens the capacity to make the choice of Liberation.

title: The 7 Levels of the Abyss
description: It takes great courage to go through the abyss and once you begin the journey you realize that there isn’t just one abyss, turns out there are 7 abysses…

title: Meditation: From Involution to Transvolution
description: Shunyamurti reveals that meditation is the act of going from involution to transvolution, which is against the logic of nature/the natural world (in alchemy, “opus contra naturam”) which works in evolution and devolution, against the illusion of a natural being/world, but recognizing God as Absolute Nothingness and surrendering to that Nothingness.

title: What’s the Importance of the Father’s Role?
description: Shunyamurti speaks about the importance of the role of the father in culture and psychological development.

title: The Failing System in a Nutshell
description: Shunyamurti speaks about the view of enlightenment in both the East and West, as well as how this has morphed through time.

title: Reaching The Fullness Beyond The Abyss
description: Student Question: How do I reach the fullness beyond the abyss?

title: How Do You Live with an Open Heart?
description: Student Question: How do you live with an open heart and help people who are suffering?

title: The Absolute Cookie Dough
description: Shunyamurti uses the example of cookie dough to explain the essential goodness of being, that we need no external validation, and that we must return to that essence and not identify with the ego that cannot taste its own sweetness.

title: The Divine Process of Yoga
description: Shunyamurti describes the process of yoga and its correlates with the Christian tradition of baptism, the Eucharist, and confession.

title: The Spiritual Origin of Theater
description: Shunyamurti describes the role of theater in culture, its connection to theory, to the invisible, to Truth and beauty.

title: The Ecosystem of Eternity
description: Shunyamurti speaks of the development of discernment and an unspoken recognition that leads one to a spiritual life and a communal life.

title: How Can The Divine Feminine Emerge?
description: Shunyamurti discusses the subject of the divine feminine and how one can allow it to emerge within oneself in the process of achieving yoga, or God realization, ego death, and spiritual liberation. He discusses the history of this archetype and the relationship between male and female in earlier times, when humans were more in balance with law and freedom, power and care, wisdom and love – and the necessity of realigning these qualities on an authentic spiritual path to awakening – a non dual pa

title: Music: The Feminine Logic of Love
description: Shunyamurti speaks about mathematics, Pythagoras, and about how music represents the qualitative, Divine Feminine side of mathematics.

title: How Fascinating is Fascination!
description: Shunyamurti speaks about the topic of fascination and its psycho-spiritual implications.

title: Sat Yoga: The Science of Joy
description: Excerpt: ”Sat Yoga is a science – it’s the most ancient science in the history of humanity; it’s the science of consciousness. . . . The science that seeks to understand: what is the true extent of the human potential? How far can we grow beyond the normal ego-consciousness that limits our lives to a melodrama of suffering . . . is there a way to grow beyond the traumas that have limited our scope, our ability to even understand the mind of God?”

title: Gratitude is a Bond of Love
description: Shunyamurti speaks about and describes three different levels of gratitude that come out of the three different registers of consciousness.

title: What Happened to Common Sense?
description: Student Question: There seems to be a lack of common sense today. Could you explain?

title: How to Deal with Fear in Meditation?
description: Student Question: How Can I Deal With the Fear That Arises In Meditation?

title: What Makes Us Human?
description: Student Question: What makes us human?

title: How Do I Deal With Unbearable Energies?
description: Student Question: How should I deal with the fear that comes when certain energies arise?

title: How to Understand Confidence
description: Student Question: What is confidence?

title: What is the Art of Living?
description: Student Question: What is the art of living?

title: How Does Memory Work?
description: Student Question: How does memory work?

title: Compassion Without Enmeshment?
description: Student Question: How can one be compassionate without becoming enmeshed in unhealthy relationships?

title: Will Meditation Lead to Awakening?
description: Student Question: Will meditation lead to awakening?

title: How to Understand Nonduality
description: Student Question: What is nonduality?

title: Will Meditation Lead to Enlightenment?
description: Will Meditation Lead to Enlightenment?

title: What is the Main Problem for a Postmodern Ego?
description: Student Question: What is the main problem for a postmodern ego structure on a spiritual journey?

title: What Are The Akashic Records?
description: Student Question: What are the akashic records?

title: What Are the Benefits of Spiritual Community?
description: Student Question: What are the benefits of living in a spiritual community?

title: How to Understand Vairagya
description: Student Question: What is vairagya?

title: Understanding Real 1, Real 2, and Real 3
description: Student Question: What are Real 1, Real 2, and Real 3?

title: Do We Choose to Waste Time?
description: Student Question: Do we choose to waste time?

title: How to Understand True Will
description: Student Question: What is true will?

title: What is Spiritual Progress?
description: Student Question: How does spiritual progress relate to the power of action?

title: Is Sat Yoga For You? – Dare the Impossible
description: Shunyamurti describes what Sat Yoga is interested in to help visitors decide if it is right for them and then describes the goals of the Sat Yoga Institute: to help one think the unthinkable, to bear the unbearable, and to dare the impossible, delving into each of these topics.

title: Why is Silence Blissful?
description: Student Question: Why is silence blissful?

title: What is the Function of Meditation Music?
description: Student Question: What is meditation music and what is its function?

title: How Can I Understand the Meaning of My Symptoms?
description: Student Question: How can I understand the meaning of my psychological symptoms?

title: How Do You Know If You’re Healing From a Psychological Symptom?
description: Student Question: How do you know if you are healing from a psychological symptom?

title: Who’s Pulling Me Down?
description: Student Question: When I feel I’m being pulled down by others, is it really my own ego that’s pulling me down?

title: Does Identification Come From Belief?
description: Student Question: Does identification come from belief, or is it even more intrinsic than that?

title: How to Maintain Peace Outside of Satsang?
description: Student Question: How do I maintain peace outside of satsang?

title: External Assistance?
description: Student Question: I feel like I’m often in need of external assistance to break through the ego. Can you please comment on this?

title: Attainment of Fearlessness
description: Shunyamurti answers that fearlessness is part of your inherent being, and that fear only arises when one (mis)identifies with a physical vehicle rather than the Self.

title: How Does the Ego Develop?
description: Student Question: How does the ego develop? Can one return to pre-egoic innocence?

title: Healing vs Transcending the Ego
description: Student Question: What is the difference between healing the ego and transcending the ego?

title: Impure Intentions
description: Student Question: If I catch myself acting from impure intentions, should I stop what I’m doing, or just try to change my attitude?

title: Sacred Sex?
description: Student Question: Is there such a thing as sacred sex?\nShunyamurti briefly discusses the trajectory of tantra, how sexual energies were sublimated through this practice, but how nowadays the true understanding of tantra has been lost.

title: Fear of an Open Heart
description: Student Question: If I open my heart, will I get hurt again?\nShunyamurti explains that every ego uses that fear to keep one’s heart closed, which in fact hurts oneself more than anyone else.

title: How Does Unconditional Love See The World?
description: Student Question: How does unconditional love see the problems of the world?

title: How Do I Know if I Am Prepared to Die?
description: Student Question: How do I know if I am prepared to die?\nShunyamurti answers that one will know if one is prepared to die when one is fearless, recognizes that there is no difference between life and death, holds no attachment to life, and that one’s only responsibility is to God.

title: Anxiety in Meditation
description: Student Question: When I meditate, it brings up anxiety. Should I continue to meditate?\nIn this question, Shunyamurti reveals that the anxiety is always present, and that meditation makes it conscious, then asks if we want to face it or continue to cover it over. He then speaks about the relationship among the knower, knowing, and known in relation to taste and beauty.

title: What is the Dark Night of the Soul?
description: Student Question: What is the “Dark Night of the Soul”?

title: Consecrating the Inner Temple
description: Shunyamurti describes consecration (making consciousness a sacred space) as the essence of healing…

title: The Voice of Accuracy
description: Student Question: There is something in me that always checks my accuracy and it can cripple the spontaneity… where does that come from and should I ignore or listen?

title: Does Meaning or Vibration Take Precedence Over Cause?
description: Student Question: Does meaning or vibration take precedence over cause?

title: Receiving the Christmas Gift
description: Excerpt: Shunyamurti explores our symbolic meanings of Christmas, why we celebrate and what is it really for?

This day has great symbolic significance. The number 12 signifies completion, wholeness, and fulfillment of one’s Godly mission. One can think of such examples as the twelve months of the year and the twelve houses of the zodiac, the twelve tribes of Israel, the twelve labors of Hercules. This number is occurring now in such an intensified form (on 12/12/12) because it is the time of completion on three different levels: the planetary level, the individual egoic level, and the spiritual level, t

title: Allowing the Power of Love to Flow
description: “Sat Yoga is a finishing school – probably the last of the finishing schools.  Feminism killed off most of them, but here we have a co-ed finishing school… and yes we are here to finish off the ego but we are doing it not by destruction but by allowing it to attain its perfect form and then the ego blossoms into the soul and if we allow it the soul blossoms into pure spirit.

title: The Solid Abyss of Triumph
description: “You know ‘SAT’ is an acronym. Did anybody know that? Do you know what ‘SAT’ stand for? Anyone know? It means: the Solid Abyss of Triumph. Triumph is the keyword; you will hear the word triumph often is the chants that Anuttara performs. In Sanskrit the word is ‘Jai’ and you hear songs that have the words ‘Jai Sita Ram’ and ‘Govinda Jaya Jaya.’ ‘Jai’ means victory or triumph, but what are we victorious over? It’s the triumph over maya, over the delusion of the ego that creates negativity, self-d

title: Compassion: Only after Dispassion
description: “Our natural state is pure awareness and absolute purity of mind and heart, and thus a state of love-filled joy. But we are only in that state if we are in the Real Self. And the problem for human consciousness is that a false self has intervened to disconnect our consciousness from the Real Self. And so we must learn to recognize the Real Self. And it’s easy to do because the Real Self differs from the false self in one essential way; the Real Self is non-arising. Any self that arises as an obj

title: Avoidance Or a Void Dance
description: We meditate in order to come out of avoidance. Because the ego is an avoidance, it is in avoidance and it is an avoidance of the Real…

title: May The Real Seva Begin
description: You could say we are like candles. The body is the wax, the mind is the wick, but until the wick is lit by the Flame of Shiva, the candle cannot do its service, and our service is to remain always lit up by that Flame. Never let that light go out. That light will itself dissolve the ego and its sufferings, and its narcissism and its lack of understanding of the Real, and the flame itself will do the work, the flame itself will inspire the thoughts in the mind that will come as gifts to oneself a

title: Seva on God’s Relation-Ship
description: Seva can be considered an acronym, a Signifier of the Eternal Values of the Absolute. But then if you ask, what is that eternal value that is most significant? You get another acronym. Silence of the Ego equals Victory of the Absolute. That is our Seva. If you think about all the myths, both east and west, about the history of humanity, they are all about a fall. Whether a fall from Sat Yuga to Kali Yuga or a fall from Garden of Eden to a fallen state of history, it is all about that…

title: The Wholly Spectrum of Seva
description: Underneath the heading of Seva, many aspects of what service really is can be enumerated that we haven’t yet covered in this retreat. One is that service involves a life of simplicity. We serve through being simple, through living simply without unnecessary and ostentatious accumulations of things, we live with the accurate necessity that diminishes our footprint on this planet to the minimal so that all can survive in the best way possible. The more simply we can each live here at Arunachala, t

title: Through Thought
description: We come together but we come together to be alone, in the innermost core of our Being. In most other social organizations whether it’s society or subculture out there or most families, people are together in order to be enmeshed and to be full of noise and conflict and projection and alienation from the Self. Here we come together to return to the Self. To stop running, to stop blaming, to stop projecting, and to stop identifying with the people in our lives, because when we join an ashram we co

title: Seva Saves!
description: This retreat will be one in which we will be discussing a subject that goes to the heart of the yogic life, a life of Seva. It is a fact that Seva Saves, but we have to know what we mean by Seva and we have to know what we mean by being saved. Because Seva is not simply work, it’s not about being a workaholic, that is not service and in fact those who have workaholic tendencies, their service is to do nothing. There has to be a balance, because often if you are a workaholic means you are running

title: No “Other” Community
description: Someone asked during the retreat about hypnosis. The ego is a state of hypnosis, a self-reinforcing hypnosis through the suggestions that the ego is constantly filling your mind with. That is why we say, at the end of every meditation, the words Aum, Shanti, Shanti, Shanti. The word Shanti means both peace and silence and it is said three times because the triple silence is necessary to shift the energy field. The triple silence… of outer silence, no intention of speaking to an other, the silenc

title: Be One World
description: We have learned that the split of the mind was caused by language, the identification with words, with thoughts. It is language that created the split between the illusion of an inside world and an outside world. There is no such thing, there is only one world. There really is no experience and imperience, it only seems that way because language makes it so, and we buy into the illusion of thoughts as if they were real, when they are utterly unreal. It is language that has split the Self from Go

title: The Yoga of Love
description: We teach how out of the original Sat Yoga emerged the seven principal yogas. But those yogas do not include bhakti yoga. But it must remain absent, because it is the secret yoga. It is the yoga of Love. And bhakti yoga must never become a separate yoga, because it is non-separation. As soon as it becomes some separate specialized form, it becomes reduced to rituals and ceremonies and mantras and chanting and holding hands and hugging and that sort of thing, and the real meaning of the yoga of Lo

title: An Intense Love Affair
description: Where is the secret key to reaching Liberation? The key is not secret, but then again it really is secret. It is well known… as a signifier. How to silence the mind is really the question isn’t it? The very simple answer is: it is Love that does that. Love is all you need in this song, but it must be real Love and it must be Love for God. No other Love will liberate you. In fact, the other kinds of love will enslave you and devastate you. But do we love God? For most people the idea of God is to

title: Beyond Identifications
description: Silence doesn’t really have a charge, in fact it is the absence of all charge. It begins usually with serenity, and that deepens into a very deep sense of peace and well-being; then, happiness emerges from that and blossoms into joy. The heart opens to that joy and then the flow of Divine Love emerges until there is the overflow into bliss. So we have to sit long enough to allow the full experience, full realization and stabilize in it, and not have even the trace of an “I-thought” thinking this

title: A Love Allergy
description: Many people have an allergy to the word love, with good reason. So we made the title of the retreat “Divine Love,” not human love, and we have to be very clear of the difference, because the human ego cannot love.

title: The Four Pillars of Yoga
description: “The traditional yogic texts say that a yogic life is built on four pillars, and attending Satsang is one of those. The other three are: simplicity, leading a simple life without excess, without ostentation, without wastage. . . . truthfulness, a yogi is dedicated to being truthful—and more than just truthful in a factual sense, but leading an authentic life. . . . the third one is seva, or service, to lead a life that’s not based on getting as much as you can for yourself, but of giving as much

title: The Pillars of Protection
description: There are four pillars that protect our meditative practice. You can think of them as holding up the inner temple. The two outer pillars are gyana and dharma. Gyana is understood as having two levels, the lower gyana and the higher gyana. In this case, the outer pillar is the lower gyana, which is the conceptual understanding of non-duality, of your absolute oneness with God; that yourself is the One Self. That absolute understanding of that and the capacity to affirm that in your mind when maya

title: On the Brink of Reality
description: “In Christianity there is a trinity as we all know: the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit. This trinity is an archetype and exists in every religion, every spiritual path, although it has different names in different paths. . . . In the yogic path, it’s only one of a number of trinities, however; we could call it the “vertical trinity.” And the equivalent in the yogic tradition is noted by the words “Sat, Chit, and Ananda.”  . . . But there is also a horizontal trinity that is often noted by

title: Understanding the Trinity
description: “We can see the Christian Trinity in many ways in both the Ramayana and the Mahabharata. . . . In the Ramayana, it is Rama, God the Father, and Sita, who is the soul/the Holy Spirit, who goes into exile at some point, captured by the demonic forces. And then you have the Son, Hanuman, who is a monkey god. Very odd, why would they choose a monkey god to represent the Son? And it’s because the human being in the state of ego-consciousness is a monkey: its monkey mind is always chattering, its inte

title: Yoga: The Science of Consciousness
description: Shunyamurti speaks about yoga – the science of consciousness

title: Archetypes
description: Shunyamurti explains what archetypes are.

title: Why Do People Choose the Lower Path?
description: Student Question: Why do the majority of people chose the easier or lower path of separation from a greater consciousness rather than the higher path of…

title: Did Older Cultures Know About the Fall of Consciosness?
description: Student Question: These symbols of Ganesha and the mouse, or Shiva and the dwarf, are a little confusing to me because if society has been in a degradation for 5000 years, how were these symbols known so long ago?

title: Inside the Temple
description: “You are all sacred beings. There are profane beings and there are sacred beings. The word ‘profane,’ comes from pro fana—before the temple; its those who stand outside the temple. And then those who enter the temple, become sacred beings.” And only by entering the ‘holiest of holies,’ the most sacred temple, the realm of the Real Self, may we complete our inward journey. “We are in the temple because we know that the only way out of the suffering of the profane world is to enter into the sacred

title: Is There Anybody Out There?
description: Student Question: Ultimately there has to be a transcendence of the thought that there is anyone there; the concept that there is anyone aware of this. Is that right?

title: What is Pure Rapture?
description: This video is a response to the following question: We’ve been reading the essay on “Critique of Pure Rapture.” And somewhere along the line I felt the lack of discernment again of what pure rapture entails and became aware that somewhere deep within the confusion to allow in the pure rapture got confused with the rape of the soul.

title: Love & Wisdom
description: “Love without wisdom is inadequate. The road to hell is paved with good intentions.” But, “Equally, wisdom without love is absolutely futile, and we know so many philosophers who have a great . . . capacity to think, but they cant love their way out of a paper bag. And thinking alone wont get you out of the box of the ego; the two must be integrated.” Likewise, there are also two manifestations of love in action. Karma yoga is the essence of love in action, “to act without greed, possessiveness,

title: A Sovereignty of Being
description: “An ability to remain unshakable when things happen that create anxiety and fear and confusion in others, we can remain a pillar of strength. And that is more…”

title: What Are Angels a Manifestation Of?
description: Student Question: What are angels a manifestation of?

title: The Triple Act of Being
description: “Sat Yoga is the process of becoming fully aware of . . . [your] radiance. And then merging into that radiance and realizing the unlimited scope of that radiance,” Sat Yoga meditation is a triple act: an unrestricted act of understanding, an unconditional act of love, and an undefinible act of Being.

title: A Complete Surrender
description: Shunyamurti explores the role of surrender in a world of illusion

title: How Do I Play My Part Correctly?
description: Student Question: We need to dissolve our ego to get in touch with our True Self. Is it bad under different circumstances to play roles in order to achieve objectives? For example, if we work in a company or we own a business or were doctors or lawyers and we need to act in a certain way to achieve an objective. Is that bad?

title: The Passion for Ignorance
description: Student Question: In the last 20 or 30 years of my life I have noticed that humanity is in decline. But my question is why the majority of people do not notice this? Why is it so difficult for them to see when there is so much evidence?

title: A Place of Refuge
description: Coming together in a Satsang, or spiritual gathering, “creates a womb of love in which to bathe, in which to let go of the stresses that we have to deal with ‘out there’ in that world of non-love, of competition and anger and brutality. And the more we create a close-knit community of love, the more this becomes a refuge. And that’s what is important to the soul of each of us; we need a refuge. Everyone needs a place to be able to come and know that they’re accepted without judgment. Where they

title: How do Archetypes Influence History?
description: Student Question: In the seminar last weekend you said that archetypes are the ones that are running history and our lives. Can you give a little more information on that?

title: Is the Garden of Eden Also Sat Yuga?
description: Student Question: In the Bible, when they talk about Adam and Eve, is that symbolically Sat Yuga?

title: Private Property vs. the Commonwealth
description: “The very idea of private property is a fairly recent one.” At one time, whether it was Native American tribes or even the commonwealths of England, property was distributed amongst the people. But, as Shunyamurti, the director of the Sat Yoga Institute, reminds us, “Now we have a situation where one percent of the population owns about 90 percent of the property of the world, and everyone is deprived of it. And this is why you have revolutions and terrorism and all of that. There is a basic unf

title: A Shift in the Superego
description: Student Comment: From my parents and everyone I grew up with I used to get, “Sex is the most beautiful thing, and overeating is the most beautiful thing, and money and cars and beaches and vacations and drinking. Its the best thing. And do it!”

title: Forming a Healthy Ego?
description: This video is a response to the following question: “I have a question regarding childhood education, of all of us. We have all received an education by our fathers and mothers, which has in a way strengthened our ego. I, as a mother, raised my children by saying to them, Yes you can; you are intelligent; you will succeed! because the child needs this to enter to school, in society, and this is what forms the ego. But what happens to that child if we don´t communicate this message of self-confid

title: Spiritually Giving Birth
description: Namaste. The good news, the eternally good news is that, God, the Supreme Being, the Intelligence that is the creative power…

title: Exercise: A Being of Light
description: Spiritual wisdom exercise teaching offered by Shunyamurti, director of the Sat Yoga Institute in Costa Rica.

title: Divestiture
description: “And so you have to ask yourself, do you want that freedom or not, you may not [Shunyamurti is referring to the freedom of Self-Realization]. But, it is the…”

title: Reverie or Evacuation
description: Spiritual wisdom teaching offered by Shunyamurti, director of the Sat Yoga Institute in Costa Rica.

title: The Impossibility of Ego Love
description: For the moth to actually dive into the flame and dissolve it is the end of the moth, so most moths circle around it, they get burned a little bit but then…

title: What is the Art of Living?
description: Student Question: What is the art of living?

title: How Can I Understand the Meaning of My Symptoms?
description: Student Question: How can I understand the meaning of my psychological symptoms?

title: Guided Meditation – Journey Through the 7 Bodies
description: In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti leads you step by step through the seven bodies into the supreme Self beyond them all. Moving from deep relaxation of the body to the stillness of pure awareness, you are invited to let go of thought, transcend the ego, and rest in the clear light of the Absolute.

title: When the Mind is Still, the Magic Happens!
description: A guided meditation into inner silence, stillness, and the Power of the Self. The Supreme Knowledge is given only to the mind of stillness.

title: Dissolving Ego into God’s Eternal Light
description: Surrender completely and merge into God’s infinite light. Release all ego, fear, and desire as divine grace purifies your being. Vibrate in sacred oneness with the Supreme, until only pure consciousness remains. Abide in stillness—liberated, boundless, and free.

title: Surrender to the Beloved: Enter the Heart of Stillness
description: In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti invites us to drop all fears, all identifications, and to abide as the zero point of consciousness—beyond the body, beyond time, beyond death. Enter into the Real, into the Beloved, into the silent radiance of pure Love.

title: Empower the Practice of Presence . . .
description: A meditation journey to the immediacy of Presence reveals its other side as Absence and Emptiness. Both must be accepted and integrated to pass over into nonduality.

title: Journey to the Depths of Being
description: Once you let go of all attachments to the body, persona, and character you’ve been playing in the phenomenal plane, you will return to your inmost presence where the wakeful, silent, blissful, center of Being is located.

title: A Meditation on Investment Strategies
description: Your only real capital is consciousness. By wisely investing your life energy in cultivating the potencies of creative intelligence, your intellect will expand into the highest emanations of the Absolute Self until all difference disappears.

title: The Real Ground Zero is the Groundless Zero Point
description: This guided meditation takes the inner voyager all the way to the core of consciousness, which is the portal to the Infinite Intelligence—the One Blissful Self. By abiding in this state of total presence, Liberation is realized.

title: How to Return to the Source of Consciousness
description: This guided meditation effortlessly glides your attention into the inmost realm of serene silence. Here you can realize you are the uncreated and deathless Self. You will be absorbed in the ecstatic splendor of the eternal awareness that is the Source of all.

title: Let All that Pertains to Ego Fall Away
description: In this serene yet powerful guided meditation, we journey into the deep interior of the soul and abide free of thoughts in the silent Heart, our core of Blissful Light, the Source of Awareness, the Point of infinite intensity. This is our true nature. Why fall again into illusion?

title: Dissolve in the Sea of Peace and Luminous Love
description: Relax into this guided meditation that will release you from the stresses of the bodily level of consciousness—and transport you into the sublime sea of inconceivable peace. Your heart will reach repose and fulfillment. You are free.

title: The Wisdom of Presence Brings Peace
description: This guided meditation focuses on the inner Ground of Presence in which the world dream appears, including one’s bodily vehicle. As the journey deepens, the joy of expansion beyond the limits of thought increases until the ecstatic energy of the Self washes out any remainder of the ego projection. Our real essence, total freedom, now reclaims and absorbs our node of consciousness into the Godhead.

title: The Fire of Love is the Portal to the Final Mystery
description: When your heart is white hot with yearning for union with the God-Self, the Fire of Yoga dissolves the existential delusion and frees the Consciousness to open to Infinity. This guided meditation will transport you through the portal—where you can be absorbed into the wondrous Light!

title: Contemplate the Inherent Freedom of Consciousness
description: A guided meditation to activate the highest latent powers of the soul. This is the time to attain liberation from the illusory limitations of the ego complex. Return to the inherent freedom of consciousness.

title: You Are Not Just a Relative of the Absolute
description: This relaxing guided meditation will lead you into the deepest core of your Consciousness, until you arrive at the serenity of body, mind, and heart that opens the inner portal to your Absolute Self. That which you were before your body was born or even conceived, and that which you shall become after your body breathes its last, is what you are now: The uncreated Eternal Presence that is always in oneness with God.

title: Relax and Offer Your Heart to Your Supreme Self
description: Your consciousness at its core is the One God-Self. Offer your whole attention to the Supreme Perceiver, Who is the Source of all that appears in the world. You have been dreamed by God in order to realize Who is your Dreamer—and enjoy the whole show from the highest perspective. You have received the Grace to attain a God’s-Eye view of this cosmic theodrama. But you must choose to open your Third Eye.

title: Thought-Free Presence Expands into Infinity
description: By relaxing the bodily vehicle and slowing the metabolism, the mind slows down as well, and the luminous energy of pure presence shines through. Gradually, all obscurations fade and the total field of infinite intensity emerges. By containing that power at the zero point, the Diamond Mind is precipitated, along with its vast intelligence and capacity for action.

title: Journey to the Center of the Real
description: In-joy this guided voyage inward to the core of consciousness, and learn to abide in this serenely joyous energy field of pure perfect presence. You shall know the blessing of being eternal, beyond fear, and filled with the infinite intelligence of God.

title: Return to Original Innocence
description: Unveil your inner presence. Drop all mental activity and be without desire. Freedom is absence of the ego.

title: The Real Self is Beyond the Reach of Mental Constructs
description: Simply by releasing all efforts of grasping the Self with the mind, and abiding in silence, in attendance upon the Source of attention, leads to the immediate opening of consciousness to the Infinite Intelligence, joy, and eternal freedom and fulfillment that is our real nature.

title: Make Your Awareness More Subtle than the Quantum Field
description: The more deeply the attention enters into the core of consciousness, the more free of limitations, ignorance, suffering, and enslavement to habits one becomes. At the Zero Point where Being is non-different from Nothingness, the Absolute Self abides as the Dreamer of the world.

title: Eternity is Present Here and Now
description: Your Buddha Nature, God-Self, Divine Presence is fully awakened always, whether or not the ego character knows it. That state is accessible to you immediately, regardless of the condition of your physical or mental apparatus. The Great Paradox is that your ego can only be absorbed into that state when you no longer either seek it or flee from it.

title: Our Only Freedom is in the Heart
description: This is the moment to return to the highest state of consciousness. The portal is the Heart. The Heart is filled with carefree joy and divine love—as well as wisdom and readiness to return to the Unmanifest. The Heart is fearless, for there is no death.

title: Be Absorbed by the Absolute Self
description: A guided meditation focusing on discernment—first of the difference between the I-thought that is the ego and the sense of Being of the soul. Then, recognize the Presence of the Love of the Goddess, and let that energy raise your attention to most subtle wavelength of the Supreme Self. Liberation will ensue.

title: A Deep Dive into the Absolute Self
description: Take the inner journey into the core of your Being. It is easy if you follow the words of this fascinating guided meditation that will ease you gently into the Heartland of your soul, where the blissful energy of eternal life is always flowing.

title: Who Has Written the Script of Your Character?
description: What is your relationship to the One Who determines how creative you are, how intelligent, and how lucky or unlucky that you are? In this meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to the Author of the character that you find yourself playing. Illumination happens when you discover Who is moving you.

title: Dive Into The Ocean of Love
description: In this guided meditation, attune to your heart, and feel the essence of love dismantling the ego’s defenses. As the heart opens, so does the mind. With love and intelligence activated, allow the presence of the Divine to fill your consciousness and the ecstasy of love will be revealed as your true Nature.

title: Enter a World of Wonders!
description: As you meditate, attune to the magical nature of reality itself, full of miraculous forms of life and fractal dimensions of beauty. Then, move past all of the narratives about yourself, all the stories that you tell yourself, and attune to the microcosm of that infinite nature within your Self, as the ego bubble bursts and you rest in the ocean of your divine, blissful nature.

title: Who Is Meditating You?
description: As you become aware of your thoughts, emotions, and energies, become keenly aware that subtle level of consciousness that is in control of your thoughts and your paradigm of reality. In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to trace this inquiry back from the NPC you believe yourself to be back to the Zero Point of Consciousness.

title: Let All Karma Drop Away
description: In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to the state of silent awareness, letting go of narratives and emotions, while tuning into the heart. When the mind is in a state of pristine purity, and free of the ego illusion, then all karma drops away, and one is left in a state of peace.

title: The Joy of Omnesia​
description: Who are you? Can you remember your name or where you’re from? In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti leads you through the joy of Omnesia, of forgetting everything you know while remaining totally calm and serene in a space of pure consciousness with no thoughts that leads you to a state of total wonderment and miraculous beauty.

title: Be Liberated – Without Turning Back
description: In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to abide in the silence of the unchanging, eternal Presence, avoiding differentiations, and to perceive and sustain the freedom while letting go of any illusory traces of belief or karma.

title: Sat Yuga Or The Singularity?
description: Bring your consciousness into union with your Real Self, emptying out any ego fantasies, thoughts, or emotions, as the Self burns away any attachments that keep you bound to a limited identity and take refuge with the Lord, the Real Self, as you enter a luminous dimension beyond time and space. From that state, make the choice to abide in the Singularity or return to the wheel of time and enter the kingdom of Sat Yuga.

title: Be Born As The Christ-Self
description: In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti invites you to be Christed, to be born as the Christ-self, by opening your heart to God and giving yourself fully to the Divine.

title: A Meditation on Love
description: Focus on the heart in this guided meditation, as Shunyamurti guides you to open your heart more and more while cultivating love for the Supreme. Love unites the attention, silences the mind, and brings salvation to the soul. Explore the Great Mystery of the Heart and realize love is nonduality!

title: A New World Begins
description: In this guided visualization, journey with Shunyamurti as consciousness witnesses the destruction of Kali Yuga and enters a new world of unimaginable beauty and splendor.

title: Accept Your Own Perfection
description: Shunyamurti guides you on a journey to Self-acceptance, letting go of the currents of thought as you pop the ego bubble and ride the wave to the ocean of your vast consciousness, accepting the perfection for all that is.

title: Awaken Through Deep Sleep
description: Focus your attention on the consciousness of deep sleep while remaining fully awake. Discover this realm of still luminosity in which your Real Self resides, fully awake, with the power to redream a new world.

title: Release All Fear
description: Wake up and unify your attention while releasing all bodily tension as Shunyamurti guides you to focus on and release any fear, leading you from hara to heart to head to chakra seven as your shakti grows and bridges the gap between the individual and the Universal.

title: The Self Has No Story
description: In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to abide in the timeless presence behind the mind, beyond thoughts, to embrace the freedom of your formless Presence, beyond any story or narrative that the mind creates, and to rest in the ocean of consciousness, in the perfect peace that accepts all as it is.

title: Dissolve in the Timeless, Luminous Presence
description: In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to deepen your meditation and focus on the essence of your consciousness, the unchanging, unwavering Presence that lies beyond the ego, to go beyond any beliefs or limitations, as the I-thought dissolves in timeless, luminous Presence.

title: Return to the Blissful Union With the Supreme One
description: In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to return to your original Nature, emptying out ego, language, memory, and desire while being filled with light, love, intelligence, wakefulness, and total Presence, abiding in the Self, prior to separation from God, in union with the Absolute.

title: Receive an Inspiration from Source
description: In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to focus on the third eye and to receive an inspiration that fills you with energy and opens your heart, which dissolves the ego and leaves you with the bliss of perfect love, fulfillment, completion, and liberation, abiding in the magical, miraculous.

title: The Portal to the Infinite Mind
description: In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to be in the state of undistracted Presence, with wakeful attention, and to activate one’s heart to focus lovefully on the Self, to charge your soul-battery, and to merge into total union with the Presence of God.

title: Enter the Ecstatic Emptiness of Your Timeless Presence
description: In this guided meditation accompanied by crystal bowls, Shunyamurti guides you to release stress held in the body, to focus the attention inward and give yourself a holiday from thinking, abiding as the unborn, infinite potential of your being, and to enter the boundary-less space in the eternity of timeless Presence.

title: Return the Soul to Full Power
description: In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti prepares you to attain blissful union with the Supreme Lord, taking you through the 7 Bodies and guiding you to sit in royal posture, with the back straight and the body comfortable, as the prana flows through the body, while love fills the soul, and the mind is focused on the Zero Point, returning the soul to full power, and sharing that power as love and light.

title: Destroy All Thoughts
description: In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to enter the silent center of Awareness, to destroy any thought that attempts to arise, to extinguish the I-thought, and to merge into the ocean of peace.

title: Feel the Love for Your Self
description: In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to release tension from the body, to shift your perspective to realize you are consciousness, to allow your heart to open in love for your Being, using the power of love to unite with your Real Self.

title: Guided Visualization: Take the Portal of Golden Light
description: In this guided visualization, Shunyamurti guides you to bring the mind and body to a state of peace following the breath, to take refuge with the Lord of the Universe, and to visualize golden white light descending into the head, which cuts through all the energies of the lower vibrational chakras, and even through the higher chakras, guiding you to union with the supreme Self.

title: Reach the Heart of Consciousness
description: In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to relax the body, to slow the breath, to settle into the profound peace of presence, to reach the core of consciousness, to reach the emptiness of the uncreated Self, and attune to the subtleties of Being that bring love, contentment, and fulfillment in the realization of what you are.

title: Take Refuge in the Supreme Self
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to relax the body and mind and focus on the consciousness that is aware of the body, the mind, the emotions, moving into the Self that does not think, act, or affected by anything that occurs, and to take refuge and feel the love that comes from the Supreme Self.

title: Taoist Meditation Exercise: Accumulate the Light of the Tao
description: Shunyamurti gives a Taoist meditation practice, guiding the chi upwards from the lower dantian (the hara) to the upper dantian (the nirvana chamber or third eye), connecting the movement with the breath.

title: Rest in Your Real Nature
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to direct the attention inward, from the awareness of the mind to the source of the awareness, to be absorbed by the eternal Self in the ecstasy of your real nature.

title: Return to the Naked Awareness
description: Shunyamurti guides us to allow all thoughts, intentions and desires to fall away until there is only naked awareness. The meditation realigns us with the presence that is without any particular identity or attachment, the oneness that is both the immanent and the transcendent.

title: Abide as the Deep Silence of the Uncreated Self
description: Shunyamurti invites us into the disinterested attitude wherein we let go of all identification with name and form and abide as the deep silence of the uncreated self that is transcendent of space and time.

title: Empty the Mind of All Thoughts
description: In this open-eyed meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to keep the eyes slightly open and the mind silent at all times, to refrain from falling into reverie or sleep, to stay in total Presence, aware only of awareness, empty and absent of any contents of consciousness, any thoughts, and any sense of duality.

title: Abide As the Uncreated Awareness
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to let all conditions, all traces of the ego, fall away, to abide as the uncreated, infinite, timeless awareness, with no attachment to life or death, and to enter into the zero point of the creative intelligence and love of the Source.

title: Dive Into the Core of Your Being
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti invites you to bring awareness to the core of your being, to let go of the root of thought, allowing the charge of shakti to overcome sleepiness/ignorance, and to follow the non-egoic thought that brings you back to the Self, finally allowing the heart to open to divine love, and integrating this into pure being.

title: Follow God’s Bliss
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti guides you to align your external and then internal posture to receive the blissful light and power of God, revealing meditation as an act of surrender to the will, intelligence, and bliss of God.

title: Overcome Death and Realize Your Immortal Self
description: In this guided visualization, Shunyamurti invites you to envision yourself on your death bed, and takes you through a simulation of death, making peace with yourself, letting go of the physical body, and being led by angelic beings to the light.

title: Shine the Luminous Lovelight of Consciousness
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti will guide you to bring your attention to the silence of Presence, reconciling the Absolute and the relative, as the golden white light of the Absolute remains, and then shines luminous love back into the world.

title: A Visionary Vision Quest
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti will help you to silence the mind and relax the body while going on a visionary adventure that leaves you jumping out of an airplane and on a sacred vision quest…

title: Do Not Avoid The Void
description: In this guided meditation, Shunyamurti will guide you into relaxing the body while stilling the mind, without trying to change or react to any thoughts, no matter what they bring up, focusing on what emotions arise, and returning to the peace of pure Presence.

title: Lift Yourself Up to the Sublime
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti will guide you to serenely relax the body and lift your consciousness up the sublime Source, as the void is filled with the luminous presence of the Self.

title: Neither Is Nor Is Not
description: In this musically influenced guided meditation, Shunyamurti will guide you to release your desire for control, to blend into the music, and to realize the Self that neither is nor is not.

title: Enter the Egoless Stillness
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti will guide you to serenely relax the body as you enter into the egoless stillness of your nature.

title: You Have Been Kidnapped…
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti simulates the experience of being kidnapped, jumping out of an airplane, and being abandoned in a far away location in order to come to terms with death. May this meditation lead you to divine rebirth!

title: Enjoy the Timeless Nature of the Self
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti will guide you into relaxing the body, becoming aware of the flow of prana, and the pure Presence that brings you into the oneness of your natural state, the inherent contentment of awareness that dissolves the chattering mind of the ego.

title: The Unlimited Power of Presence
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti will guide you peacefully and serenely to release identification with thoughts and claim the unlimited power of Presence

title: The Boundariless Self
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti will guide you peacefully and serenely to release yourself from the contricting grip of the ego and return to the Boundariless Self, that is always Here and Now.

title: Recognize the Perfection of All That Is
description: ​In this meditation, Shunyamurti will gently guide you to relax the body, open to the ever-present Source of love and recognize the perfection of all that is

title: Relax Into the Serenity of Presence
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti will gently guide you to relax the body, slow the breathing, and examine the source of the “I” who you truly are in order to realize the serene spontaneous freedom that is inherent to your being at every moment and the reflection of that Self that is the cosmos.

title: The Naked Presence of Consciousness
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti will guide you peacefully and serenely to release yourself from the contricting grip of the ego and return to the naked, ever-present Soure that is always Here and Now.

title: Return to the Source of the Blissful Light
description: In this meditation, Shunyamurti will guide you to focus on the point of light (jyoti bindu) at the center of the brain, flooding consciousness with divine, blissful light, as your attention traces this energy back to its Source…

title: The Unreality of the World: A Fascinating Enigma!
description: It is now widely recognized in the fields of medicine and psychology that meditation is a powerful instrument for the management of stress, the strengthening of the immune system, and for the acceleration of healing processes in the body. Many clinical studies have validated the effectiveness of meditation not only for physical healing and the diminution of anxiety, but for the improvement of the quality of life. The sense of happiness and inner contentment has been correlated to the capacity to

title: Ecstasy and the Eschaton
description: It is now widely recognized in the fields of medicine and psychology that meditation is a powerful instrument for the management of stress, the strengthening of the immune system, and for the acceleration of healing processes in the body. Many clinical studies have validated the effectiveness of meditation not only for physical healing and the diminution of anxiety, but for the improvement of the quality of life. The sense of happiness and inner contentment has been correlated to the capacity to

title: Welcome to the Deceptocene!
description: It is now widely recognized in the fields of medicine and psychology that meditation is a powerful instrument for the management of stress, the strengthening of the immune system, and for the acceleration of healing processes in the body. Many clinical studies have validated the effectiveness of meditation not only for physical healing and the diminution of anxiety, but for the improvement of the quality of life. The sense of happiness and inner contentment has been correlated to the capacity to

title: HEAL: A Documentary Film Night Essay
description: As part of our ongoing film studies at Sat Yoga, we screened HEAL, a documentary by Kelly Noonan Gores which explores the power of the mind to heal the body. This is Shunyamurti’s introduction and reflections on the film.

title: The Hustler, starring Paul Newman
description: Why The Hustler? So many allusions to recent teachings could of course be mentioned. It is about the game of pool, which involves disappearance and death, but also growth of character and facing the deepest pain, thus becoming the Bodhisattva of Compassion.

title: Bab’Aziz: The Prince Who Contemplated His Soul
description: Tonight we have the privilege of visiting the remains of a mythical world that once was real. The title of the film is Bab’Aziz: The Prince Who Contemplated His Soul. Bab’Aziz is the name of the protagonist. The prince is only one of the characters in the stories that he tells and that is intermixed with the story that is unfolding before our three eyes.

title: Becoming Nobody: A Tribute To Ram Dass
description: This collection of precious moments from the talks and interviews of Ram Dass offers a gracious and honest recollection of the spiritual journey he went through publicly, his growth, humor, self-acceptance, and most importantly, his courage in facing death.

title: Chronicle of a Summer
description: The ego is haunted by the shame of its inauthenticity. The ghost of delusion increases its intensity of terror by the ambivalence and self-doubt it shines into its victim with a blinding ray of darkness.\nThe spell-binding film, made in 1961 in France, by Jean Rouch, entitled Chronique d’un Été (Chronicle of a Summer) is such a weapon of egoic destabilization. Rouch had been a cultural anthropologist, studying with the famous Marcel Griaule, whose fame arose from his study of the Dogon tribe in

title: Mozart’s Magic Flute, As Directed By Bergman
description: Tonight we shall have the privilege of participating in the operatic magnum opus of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, completed and staged in 1791, only two years before his death at the age of 35, at the height of his creative powers.

title: A New Model of Psychoactivity
description: In the traditional framework, there are four states of consciousness—waking (jagrat), dreaming (swapna), deep sleep (sushupti), and Samadhi (referred to in this model as turiya, which means fourth). When the yogi attains permanent Samadhi (usually referred to as sahaja nirvikalpa Samadhi) then this becomes the only state, which subsumes all the rest—and this ultimate state is referred to as “beyond the fourth” or turiyatita.

title: Sat Yoga Meditation
